text: 37,5cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora). U: Wazig koperkleurig met een gebroken witte schuimkraag. G: Groene appel, hout, rood fruit en brett. S: Zoetzuur. Rood fruit, hout en brett. M: Dorstlesser met medium carbonatie.

750 ml bottle. Quiet pour with modest carbonation and a wonderful complex aroma 
of malt vinegar, sour cherry, and hard fruit. This beer has a hazy red brown colour with a sepia head and adequate lace. The sour fruit start has candy sugar notes expanding into the middle. The finish is long with an undertone of cherry and Belgian yeast adding to the complexity. A most refreshing Flemish ale.

Kolor: ciemnobursztynowy, herbaciany, delikatnie zamglony.
Piana: średnio obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, sycząca, w miarę trwała.
Zapach: sporo aromatów czerwonych owoców, wiśni, śliwek, wyraźnie estry, trochę rozpuszczalnika, aromaty winne, trochę drewna, lekkie akcenty dzikich drożdży, całość lekko kwaskowa.
Smak: dość wytrawne, sporo nut ciemnych owoców, wiśni, śliwek, wyraźna kwaśność, skontrowana delikatną słodyczą, lekka taniniczna cierpkość, trochę nut drewna, lekkie nuty winne, niska goryczka.
Wysycenie: średnie.

Barrel Aged blind tasting at Andrews. From bottle. Cherry nose, tart and astringent. Big vinegar on nose and first sip. Tart cherry. Bourbon sweet depth. A little sweet and thin by finish. Fruit skin. Apple brandy. Modest booze. Nice.

draft samplers at highland beer fest. poured a lighter red/brown with off white head. the aroma is almost like a flanders red. earthy sour soft and tame nothing but pure bliss on the nose. the flavor was amazingly good. nice soft sour tingled the taste buds a touch earthy, sour slight funk its all that and more.

Strong pointy beer with a lot of flavor and smell. A very intens, yet refreshing fruity old belgian beer. If you love sherry, be sure to taste this! A taste of oak, caramel and sherry. Very strong, intriguing beer.

Vintage 2014. En bouteille. On mavait dit beaucoup de bien de cette bière, je navais jamais encore goûté. On ouvre la bouteille vite! Un liquide rouge/bourbogne séchappe du goulot avec une mousse blanche légèrement rosée. Au nez, wow! Acide acétique, vinaigre balsamique, petits fruits rouges acidulés. Au goût, acidité élevée, superbe balance entre le sucre résiduel et lacidité, vinaigre balsamique sucré, notes de cerises. Belle complexité, Rodenbach sont vraiment maître dans le vieillissement en barriques.

2014, en bouteille. Voilé, couleur briquelée/brunâtre. Arômes très balsamique, notes de de framboise et de cerise. Touche très vineuse. En bouche, corps moyen, acidité persistante, avec des touches boisées et un caractère fruitée sur des éléments de noyaux de cerise. Effervescence moyenne/faible. Superbe équilibre.
blurry brown color, thin foam retention. tastes woody and sour like vinegar. too acidic feeling. still quality brew.
Piękna wiśnia, rocznik 14, owoc, szlachetność, równowaga, piwo o elegancji wielkich win, dla miłośników stanów pośrednich między ułożonym chianti a poważnym ipa.
Kran w Brewdog. Intesywny aromat wiśni, nuty skórzane, octowe, winne. Dużo ciemnych owoców. Nuty beczkowe wyczuwalne. Pestkowosc wkrada się po ogrzanie.
W aromacie dużo wiśni, skóry, wina i octu. W smaku podobnie. Wszystko gra ze sobą idealnie. Nie przepadam za kwasami, ale ten jest wypasiony.

W zapachu mnóstwo skóry, drewna, suszonych ale i ciemnych owoców, takich jak wiśnie, czarna porzeczka. Niuanse winne i octowe. Smak podkreśla to, co oferował nos. Winne, octowe, owocowe, kwaśne. Niezwykle skomponowane i zbalansowane, pije się przyjemniej z każdym łykiem.

June 28, 2013 - with blankboy, gregclow, jercraigs & mabel - 750ml white faux ceramic corked & caged bottle - 2009 vintage (have had it several times since, usually the same reaction). Mostly clear reddish-amber with a solid creamy beige lasting head, some lacing. Subtle Flemish sour - malt vinegar, tart cherry, plenty of thick sweet malt. Taste - tart apple, cherry, vinegar, not much alcohol presence - loved it. Light body, somewhat acidic, a little undercarbonated - a real sweet and sour finish, quite tingly, incredibly drinkable.

Bottle from a Colruyt in Ghent. Pours cloudy dark orange/brown with a diminishing, frothy, off-white head. The aroma contains ripe fruits, wine, vinegar, cherries, oak and some caramel. It tastes medium sweet and medium to heavy sour with a sharp tartness and a lot of wine-like qualities. Lingering sourness in the finish, no detectable hops. Fizzy carbonation and slick/oily texture. Excelling in its style, but not entirely my glass of beer.

Geschonken als compensatie wegens een misverstand in de communicatie op hun website over de 750 genummerde Rodenbach Alexander flessen waarbij de indruk werd gewekt dat deze 750 flessen die online werden verkocht de enige beschikbare zouden zijn op de Belgische markt. Excuses met plezier aangenomen. Deze afgehaald bij mijnbierdoos.be op 18/11/2016. En geproefd op 15/4/2017. Rodenbach Vintage 2014 foeder n° 192 is van uitzicht rood en helder en geeft een creme-kleurig schuim. Dit laatste komt overigens in een normale hoeveelheid en is zwak wandklevend, dit schuim slaat echter vlug neer en verdwijnt, enkele kleine eilandjes niet te na gesproken, helemaal. Toch zijn er een middelmatige hoeveelheid CO2 belletjes van middelmatige grootte op te merken. Het aroma is vooral karamel-zoet en fruitig door de kersen, ook wat karamel-mout en nog een lichte hout-toets zijn op te merken. De smaak is niet verwonderlijk zoet en ook fruit-zurig, allebei echter niet overdreven. Vooral de eikenhout toets komt hier prominenter te voorschijn. In de mond geeft Rodenbach Vintage 2014 foeder n° 192 een volle smaak en hij is ook wat droog en met nog een normale prikkeling is het een lekker harmonieus biertje. De nasmaak vloeit wat uit is vooral zoet en lichtjes zuur. Het zoete en het zure vormen hier een goede combinatie, het is een lekker biertje al zouden de smaken voor mij nog wel iets krachtiger mogen zijn maar de karamel toch ietjes minder.

2014 Vintage. Great looking, smelling, and tasting Flanders Red. The cherry sweetness from the regular Rodebach is dialed way back, allowing the tartness to dominate. Complex, with oak and fruit flavors mixing in as well, giving the final product a nice balance. Delicious.

Cudowne, bogate piwo! Mamy tu dużo winnych, octowych, wiśniowych, jabłkowych, cukrowych, trochę drewna, wanilli. W tę całość świetnie wkomponowana jest zarówno słodycz, jak i kwaśność. Genialny balans. Bardzo wysoka pijalność.

Drank 26-4-17 with Pim @ Cafe Moenen (2013 bottle). Rich cherry taste when you keep the beer in your mouth somewhat longer. However, I found the sourness to be really sharp. Maybe Im still getting used to these kinds of beers...

2014
Wyglad: klarowne, ciemny bursztyn, drobnopecherzykowa - pozostaje po niej pierścień 
Aromat: aromaty winne, przyjemna kwaskowosc, zielone jabłka, ocet
Smak: kwaśno, winność, lekka wanilia, ocet, zielone jabłka, dębina, cierpkosc, nasycenie średnio niske
My first sour ale. As a fairly new customer, it appearsI dont have the taste ready for that. Although, I bought a few to revisit this beer strongly recommended by two connoisseurs.
Tap at the Answer. Reddish Brown with thin head. Nice sour vinegar aroma. Tart. Nice.

(Vintage 2014) clear ruby red beer with head that disappeared as quickly as it was Coke. Aroma has oak barrel, wooden notes, round ripe fruits and red berries with ending in cherry note. Taste starts with red berries, sour cherry and then wooden oak flavors pop up and the sourness increases in the end. Medium to full body and high fizzy carbonation. Still has a little rough edges, would be interesting to see how this would evolve through the years. If I would have patience for that sort of thing.

Herbaciane, klarowne, piana biała, dość skromna. Jest ocet, kwaśne jabłko, wiśnie. Dość słodkie, trochę miodowo, troszkę kwasku. Chyba nieco lepsze niz Duchesse, ale i tak spodziewałem się wiele więcej, wersja Grand Cru jest ze 2 poziomy wyżej.

(2012 bottle) Vermelho vinho de média turbidez, espuma rosada de média formação e pouca persistência. Aroma de vinagre, alta acidez, uva vermelha, vinho. Paladar de média acidez e leve dulçor. Corpo leve e média carbonatação. Final persistente de uva e avinagrada, amadeirado leve muitíssimo bem inserido, estilo que demanda experiência mas que se torna imperdível.
Pours clear copper, slightly red. Aroma is sour, berries. Taste is sour, fruity, balanced.

Almost clear deep purple color with a off white layer on top. Good intensity in the aroma. Medium + body and a soft carbonation level. Oily texture. Pleasant acidity and a fine mellow sweetness. Vinegar, cherries and oak are dominating the flavor. Nice tasty evening sipper. Probably a bit to much vinegar. 2013 version.[Bottle at Humlekyllingene - March meeting 17]

Bardzo ładnie się prezentuje, miedziane z pianą w kolorze piasku. Przy pierwszym niuchu od razu czuć winny aromat z nutami drewnianymi, trochę wanilii, jabłek i czerwonych owoców. W smaku ponownie winne, trochę dzikie. Dobry balans między wytrawnością, kwaśnością a słodyczą. Żaden z tych smaków nie dominuje, a jedynie współgra ze sobą tworząc bardzo ułożone i pijalne piwo.
On tap at Lambicus. Brown colour with off white head. Fruity, caramel aroma- Sweet, caramel, fruit, grape, acidic taste. Medium body.

Zapamiętałem go jako świetny i wielowymiarowy flanders, świeżo po nalaniu pachniał lekko octowo i owocowo ale z czasem pokazywał swój złożony charakter w postaci lekkiej wanilii i słodyczy. Bardzo dobre piwo, jedyny minus że przy przełykaniu kwasek drapie  w gardło ;)

750ml bottle, Vintage 2010 Barrel 144. Probably bottled in 2012, aged 5 years in perfect conditions. Pour pale brown with red reflexions, almost no foam, just a small cloud. Aroma of sweet balsamic vinegar, wood and green apple. Low body, low carbonation probably due to its age and the very small cork they use. Oily and slick. Taste is tart, woody, lightly malty and on the cider side.
Zuerst kräftig ledrig und fast unangenehm. Später KRIEKig virtuos. Hart SOUR und unwiderstehlicher Rebell. OAKED LIKE HELL !!! LIKE IT!!! 0,375l Botlle from MUNICH. LOVE GETRÄNKE OASE!!!

2014 Bottle. Pours a ruby red with a lasting foamy off white head. Aroma is of cherries, raisins, gigs, red fruits, raspberry, caramel, lightly acidic, plums. Taste is of cherries, balsamic vinegar, plums, red fruits, nuts, caramel, figs. Oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

0.375 l bottle from former Firma Bier, 2012 vintage, bottled in 2014, best before July 2017. Clear, dark brownish red with a medium large, frothy, stable, off-white head. Sweetish, slightly sourish, fruity and vinous aroma of lots of cherries and oak, caramel, vinegar, some vanilla and red grapes, even a touch of chocolate. Sweetish, moderately sourish, fruity and vinous taste of cherries, oak, quite a bit of vinegar, red wine, vanilla and slight hints of chocolate, followed by a medium long, moderately tart, rather woody-dry, vinous finish. Medium body, slightly astringent and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Refreshing, complex, very tasty, great balance, just wonderful!

75cl anno 2007, about ok to open a 10 yo.
Cuivre restant assez clair, col beige retombant vite. Très peu de bulles sont à distinguer.
Arôme au nez fin fruité, entre un Madère et Sherry, note de massepain, fruits noirs et rétro fin aigrelet qui nest pas trop dominant. Petite oxydation.
Palais est finemetn aigrelet avec une oxydation particulière qui est tout en bonification.
Malté tirant sur léger biscuité, fruité noir de cerise, cassis et mûre. Vinaigre léger avec petite note de gingerbread et une effervescence minimaliste. Retrouve un peu du coté picotement du chêne sans en avoir la rondeur boisée.

750ml bottle. Pours deep ruby red / brown, translucent, small foamy lacing. Aroma is tart apple and cherry, with layers of blackberry and cream. Body is medium with a creamy texture with a light carbonation. Refreshing sharpness and tartness. Enjoying with a black bomber cheddar. Lovely combination!

Excellent aroma jumps out of the glas. Fruit, cherry, even smells of sourness.
Lovely taste, nice sour touches, notes of carmel, long lasting finish.
Superb beer!

Colour reminds me of sherry, with a very thin head on top. Lovely mouth feel, brought on by the tartness and some good carbonation. Nose has apple, vanilla, caramel, cherry and aforementioned sherry. Flavour has fresh, tart apple, vanilla, wood, cherry and wine vinegar. Complex yet refreshing.

Doft: banan, funk, tvättmedel, choklad, syrlig, vinäger, lite alkohol.
Smak: citron, syrlig, maltig, banan/knäckebröd, sött, lite bittermandel, lite aceton, lite brunt socker.
2012 (Barrel no. 170): Lovely vanilla oak, more caramel and dry fruit sweetness, smoother medium acidic acid sourness. Smoother and more complex as base. (compared to rodenbach grand cru)

Flaska från SB, vintage 2013 (Foeder n 149, "The Sire"). Provning med Nerikes Ölsällskap. Kopparröd/brun med beigebrunt skum. Syrlig doft uppbackad av mycket sötma, kola, råg, brunt socker. Medelstor, lätt torr. Sötsyrlig i smaken med kola, brunt socker, brödsirap, rödvinsvinäger och ekfat. Jämn och fin, välbalanserad. Dryga tre års lagring verkar har gjort den väl.
Uzupełnianie profilu z własnych notatek / zapisków, z racji postanowienia założenia konta na rb.

Vintage 2012 dégusté en compagnie de Marco. Une grande rouge des Flandres, profonde et intense. Beaucoup de vanille provenant dun vieillissement prolongé en barriques, du bois, du chêne, du foudre. Des petits fruits rouges, une acidité importante tant au nez quen bouche, des vapeurs ac.tiques balancées par une rondeur des plus appréciables. Corps huileux, bulle rapide, très fruitée et boisée, tout ce que jaime dune rouge des Flandres se retrouve dans cette unique bière.

750ml bottle, vintage 2014, barrel # 192, reddish-brown colon, with a fluffy beige head, with a very nice cherryish sweet and sour nose, with some light mild fruity oak barrel tannin, light sweet balsamic vinegar, mild toasted, caramel malt accents and a subtle sour passionfruit, lemon rind, funky wild yeast note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a very good fruity cherry, passionfruit, guava sweet and sour character with some good sweet vinous oak barrel, toasted, caramelized malty, faint juicy lemon, subtle pineapple tartness, brown sugar balsamic vinegar flavours, leading towards a nice fruity sweet and sour, toasted maltiness, fruity oak barrel tannin finish.
It is a better version of Rodenbach Grand Cru. Tastes quite similar but all of the qualities of grand cru are slightly better.

Aroma has malt with caramel and bread, is sour with cherry and tart and a hint of mold. Taste is malty with bread and caramel yet sour and tarty with sour cherries. Finish is very well balanced malty, sour and dry. Great flemish red!
Bottle from LCBO. Pleasant tart aroma. Sour cherry and sweet caramel in the taste. Delicious!

2012 vintage.
Aroma: zoete kers, aardbei, mout, zurig, karamel.
Smaak: zure kersen, balsamico, aardbei, wat hout, wat rode wijn, zurige afdronk.

Had hem zuurder verwacht.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2017 Tap (AleBrowar, Wroclaw). Barwa miedziana, piana bezowa, slaba. Aromat kwasny, winny z nutami drewnianymi, wytrawnymi, owocowymi. W smaku kwasne, winne ze slodkim posmakiem, lekko waniliowym, do tego dochodza nuty wytrawne, drewna. Piwo bardzo dobrze ulozone, dosc gladkie jak na kwacha, pijalne.
Fruity, full body, beautiful color, quick disappearing head, nice lacing ak

750ml bottle [2012 vintage]. Cloudy reddish colour with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Tart-ish, fruity aroma, notes of red berries, vinegar, balsamico, oak. Taste is tart, fruity, tangy, moderately sweet, caramel malty counterpart, notes of red berries, cherry, morello, hints of vinegar, balsamico, some oak, a touch of vanilla, on the sweet side additionally hints of honey, a touch of mandarine; gentle carbonation. Superbly balanced, complex - pure pleasure.

Lots of raspberries, strawberries, cherries, red currant in nose followed by some vinegar, funk. Pours deep red with beige head. Taste is medium sweet-sour with red fruits, vinegar, funky notes, caramel, wood. Finish is bit tart without bitterness. Overall delicous.
Excellent "lambic" beer... if you like the Grand Cru beer, you must taste this one! Barrel in your mouth!

Warka 2014
Aromat lekki ocecik, ale taki przyjemny winny, troche owoców w stylu malin, dosyć slodko kwaśny, bardzo słabo czuć beczkę 
W smaku krótki ale bardzo intensywny kwaśny, nisko wysycone, dosyć pełne, posmak słodki owocowy, troche beczkowy, troche karmel

Dobre polecam

on tap @ Ei8ht Ball / Bellevue KY --- Aroma of malt. Hazy amber brown, off-white head that sinks to the rim, beands of lace. Taste is slightly tart malt that gradually sweetens, adding toffee on a medium fizzy swallow. The long finish stays on the sweet side. Good brew.

Dimmig rödbrun öl med ett smutsvitt skum. Doft av körsbär, röda bär, lätta vinägertoner, trä och vanilj. I smaken tar syrligheten en lite större plats. Bra balans mellan sötma och syra. Lätt kolsyra och oljig munkänsla.
Aroma: vinegar, wood and fruity. Taste: cherry, caramel, vainilla, strawberries...tasted in Olut Sabadell

Rödbrun färg. Vinäger i både doft och smak. Vinkänslan är påtaglig. En syrlighet gör att det drar i gommen, spännande 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

tried the versions of 2012 and 2013 simultaneously... the aroma is fruity and, a little bit, woody with shades of berries, apple vinegar, sour citrus and red wine... the taste of fruits and red sparkling wine with notes of sour berries, fresh cherry, sour citrus and sour plum... sour and dry aftertaste with woody tartness...

750 ml bottle (thx, Justin W.!). Pours an opaque reddish brown with a ran head. Aroma is sour, fruity, woody, cherry notes. Taste is pretty the same with some fermented vegetable and fruits notes. Low to moderate sweetness and sourness. Good stuff, but I would prefer more body.
Tap Clear amber colour with small head.Aroma of ripped and tart fruity,most like apples and acid good tart mouthfeels with flavors oak and wood really tasty kind of beer sour but still well balanced.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. 2014 (Barrel No. 192)
Bottle 2013 vintage. Light acetic character wins malts. love beer vs wine battle.

Prueba en Cimmeria 26..12..2016. (r921). Vintage 2013. Color marron oscuro con espuma beige. Aromas y sabores ácidos ligeramente dulces con toques de maderas empapadas y ligeramente especiales. Bastante buena. Para repetir.

Bottled. Very lively. Brown body, huge brown head with small bubbles. The aroma has licorice, cherry, red wine and apples. The taste is complex, full of more fruity notes with cherry and apple in the center. The finish is lovely sour.
année 2011, dégustée récemment. Pour les amateurs du genre. Forte acidité, très boisée et aromatiquement complexe. Une petite allure de vin
One of the best beers I have ever tasted. You can taste the perfection an complexity of the aging process and its tartness is refreshing even on a winters evening.

Bottle. This is really not possible to evaluate in one single rating, due to the variance between vintages. Still, here it goes... Theyre all really nice Flemish reds, with acetic, fruity brett, cherry notes, berries and wood in some form. Some balsamic vinegar, red wine, grapes and sherbet could be thrown in as well. Pours clear dark maroon, with an off white, creamy head of differing size depending on vintage. Medium body, with soft to average carbonation. The flavour lingers tart to acetic, with balanced fruity brett and wooden barrels.

Pours caramel with a medium frothy off white head. Aromas of ripe red apples, bitter almonds, oak, soil, farmhouse. Taste is funky and sour with strong fruity notes. Mouthfeel is dry and tart with medium carbonation. Very good.

2014 vintage. Clear amber liquid with a thin, but creamy off-white head. Aroma is rust and acetic acid with hints of caramel. Sour ales are not really my cup of tea. Mouthfeel is a really nice surprise. Well balanced taste with lots of residual sweetness that weight the balsamic taste. Well done!

Pułapka, 11.12.2016. Pachnie jak ocet winny na bazie wiśni - lubię (szczególnie do galartu) więc specjalnie czepiać się nie będę. W smaku trochę lepiej bo mniej octowo a bardziej winnie i owocowo z odrobiną owocowej słodyczy. Trunek zdecydowanie do bardzo powolnego sączenia. Bardzo ciekawy styl jednak fakt, że to piwo jest w Top 50 świadczy dobitnie o tym, że nie jest to styl dla mnie.

2014 Vintage on tap @Pułapka Gdańsk (Dec 2016)
Aroma: Vinegar, oak, wine, red fruit 
Looks: Hazy dark red amber body with small short head
Taste: Tannic sourness over a rather sweet body. In time as it warms up the sweetness goes away and is overwhelmed by the tannins. Red tart fruit, small bitterness. 
Feel: Medium body, soft carbonation 
Overall: Very complex and well balanced beer. Loved it!

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2016 Hout, azijn (minder en subtieler dan in Rodenbach Grand Cru) en kers in de neus. Deze komen terug in de smaak, met aanvulling van een lichte karamel. Heerlijk! Leuke zachte afdronk. Smaak blijft nazinderen.
2013 vintage. Ruby/chestnut body, light tan head. Nose is balsamic, cherry, strawberry, caramel. Flavor is cherries, balsamic, under ripe strawberry, oak. Very sweet, medium tart. Limited acetic.

Rödbrun, disig med medelstort skum. Syrlig doft med körsbär och äpplen, lite vinäger och lite sötma. Smaken domineras av syrliga körsbär och äpplen, men en lite fin sötma balanserar, här finns också lite pomerans och en liten kryddighet, ekfatstoner avslutar det hela. En skön balans mellan syra och sötma, en riktigt god öl.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bottle, 2013 edition. Light hazelnut brown with a medium sized tan head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Dark cherries, dark wood, minerals, light turpentine and sawdust in the nose. Good. Initial sweetness in a filling mouthfeel is followed by notes of dark wood, cherries, mild fatness, turpentine and yoghurt. Sourness takes over into the finish. Medium/full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet and light sour. Long finish with sourness and cherries.

Bottle. Snifter. Deep red/dirty brown with medium, dirty white, semi-thick head. Poor head retention and moderate lacing. Strong dry wine notes, along with apples, cherries and berries, which give it dryness and tart character. The apple vinegar/acetone notes are close to medium, esp in the beginning after opening the bottle, you can experience more intense apple vinegar aromas. Beside this, oaky and barrel influence is noticeable, may be not so strong as some ppl describe (like vanilla etc.). Clean, not so intense malty profile - fruity and organic with a touch of caramel. Taste is semi-sweet, its a little surprise, because youd expect dry, tart beer with strong acidic profile and sourness. First sip reveals slightly sour flavors, which intensifies, but later on the semi-sweet character is dominant, but not so strong. It pretty well balance the sourness and tartness. Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, finish is semi-sweet, cherry, astringent. Light warming is noticeable - due to ABV and acidity. Well drinkable. In general this one is regarded, as on of the state of the art beers, describing sour brown ale. I dont have much experience with this style, but this other level of experience. This one is very good balance, drinkable with strong organic, fruity notes like cherries and apples. Unpredictable and not cliched.
2011 edition. Pours a crimson red with no head. Rich nose full of fruits. Tart initial flavour which gives way to the carbonation and fruit palate.
Bottle at Red Hot. Light acetone, Vineous notes. Red golden, low head. Medium dry body, dark sugar, like light berry vinegar, dry finish

Old rating rerated 19.11.2016, 0,75l bottle (2013 vintage) @ Cerveceria Arte&Sana:
Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is sour-ish dry, sorrel, oak, minerals, grass, bark, mild vinegar, berry skin, old cellar, sour fruits, soda powder. Taste is sour-ish dry, soda powder, sorrel, mild vinegar, oak, grass, minerals, berry skin, sour red berries, hints of balsamico. Medium bitterness, sour-ish mouthfeel. Nice.
Bue en bouteille. Année 2013. Aromes de cerise, boisé, pointe vanillée. Pas de sucre, acidité présente. Très complexe et très bien équilibrée.

2014 - Copper color. Medium carbonation. Complex aromas of caramel, light figs, almonds, vanilla. Very balanced flavor of cherries, vanilla, caramel, touch of vinegar. With a lovely tart finish. This has almost no hard edges to it. It is smooth and elegant. It is lovely in the mouth, but after every swallow, I get a bit weak. It sends me shivers. This is a fantastic beer! One the best I?ve ever had.

Piwo ciemno rubinowe, zmętnione, piana mała, szkła nie zdobi, redukuje się do pierścienia. Aromat - bardzo intensywny, winny, wiśniowy, intensywne nuty beczkowe, robi wrażenie. Smak - zwala z nóg - radykalnie kwaśne, bardzo owocowe, zarazem słodkie jak kompot. Posmak bardzo długi, kojarzy się z kwaśnym jabłkiem, drewniany. Pomieszanie smaków owocowo-kwaśnych i owocowo-słodkich +drewno tworzy w tym piwie niepowtarzalną całość. Wraz z ogrzewaniem nuty drewniane coraz bardziej intensywne w aromacie i w smaku. Niepowtarzalne, unikatowe. Rozkosz konesera. Beczka 170.

Deep brownish red, white head. Nose is sour cherries and berries, oak. Tastes sweet and sour, vinegary acidous, aged oak, vinous notes. Excellent, nicely balanced.Earlier Rating: 10/9/2015 Total Score: 4Rodenbach flight at Ushers (Grand cru, Rosso, Vintage, Caractere rouge). Pours deep ruby. Nose is sourish, oak, tart cherries, apples. Taste is sour, wood, apples, fruits, cherries, vinegar but also sweetness. Quite similar to Caractere rouge but finish lacks some elegance Caractere has. Anyway, excellent stuff.

Lots of bottles and vintages throughout the years. Balsalmico cherry bomb with notes of apple and honey as well. Aftertaste slightly burns through the nose. Just spectacular stuff. Gets more complex and less sweet with age.

375ml cork and cage bottle at home in Richmond, as Rodenbach 2011 Vintage Barrel No 95, 7%. Thin pink pour to form a very dark ruby beer, clear and still when held to light with a pale white-pink head. Aroma is rhubarb, blackberries and jam tart, light sherry. Body is smooth and rounded with soft carbonation. Taste is rounded and full with tart berries, light acidity, oak, just a touch acetic, sour cherry, some Ribena in the finish. Deep concentrated fruits without a corresponding sweetness. This pushes my buttons a lot more than I thought it would. Really tasty stuff.
Bottle. Bronze amber color. Aroma: household vinegar, wine, raisins, sour, fruity, barrel. Taste: wine, vinegar, sour and sweet, oaky.

Robe brune, mousse peu abondante. Nez puissant sur des notes balsamiques, puis de la cerise acidulée sur un fond de bois, note lactée et chocolatée. Une bouche à lattaque acidulée, de la puissance, de la tension, une bulle fine, de la longueur à la fois sur le bois et sur lacidité. Une très belle bière plus boisée que fruitée.Earlier Rating: 5/15/2015 Total Score: 4.5Robe brune, reflets rougeâtres. Nez puissant où lon retrouve des notes balsamiques, de la cerise, de la prune, un boisé délicat, du caramel, de vanille. Bouche à lattaque superbe délégance et de fruit, de lampleur, de fraîcheur et une très longue finale fruitée et acidulée. Un régal dun équilibre impressionnant.
Pours a medium caramel brown with a thin off white head. Nice tart fruity aroma. Tart and slightly sour cherry taste with some oak flavor. Smooth and somewhat less tart than the Grand Cru. Enjoyable.

As batch 149. Bottle 12cl sample. The aroma has red fruits (raspberry and cherry) , hint of pear, leather. Dark red coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is light sourish with red fruit, red wine and some woody touch. Light-medium bodied beer, above average carbonation. Very tastefull.

MBR Sour Beer fest. Ooh, I didnt get to get a lot of this. Murky dark reddish body. A nice, clean, classic blend of berry notes, solid malt backbone and well integrated acetic notes. Very good and Ill hopefully rerate it soon to elaborate.

Bottle. 2012 vintage barrel 170. Hazy brown pour with tan head. Some particles. Aroma is sour with sweet vinegar. Taste is surprisingly fresh and balanced. Nice sparkling feel to it. Some wooden notes. Do not like the aroma but besides this the beer is really great. Not that familiar with the type so this might explain my missing ability to fully appreciate this. Light body. Medium carbonation

Botella de 2011.
Color marrón turbio con capa de espuma amarronada de un dedo de grosor. No se percibe carbonatación. El aroma es sidroso, avinagrado, ácido. El sabor es también ácido, pero bastante balanceado (lo suficiente como para que mi paladar no se cansara bebiendo una botella de 750 ml. durante la tarde). Personalmente no encuentro el maíz, ni la vainilla, pero tanto el aroma como el sabor remiten a manzana, a sidra. Increíble Sour Red/Brown. Compleja pero a la vez fácil de beber. Escasísima graduación. Todo un acierto para según qué tipo de comidas.
UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 Flaska från SB. Mörkt brunröd med beige skum. Frisk och syrlig doft. Oväntat söt och mustig smak med fin syrlighet på slutet av äppelkart.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2017 Robe brune sombre aux reflets rouges, claire. Mousse blanc cassé moyenne, tenue moyenne. Nez puissant de fermentation, boisé, légèrement fruité. Attaque acide sur la pomme verte, déploiement de vanille, caramel et amertume (douce) en fin de bouche. Belle longueur, très ronde. Notes de cerise, boisé très présent. Carbonatation moyenne très agréable. Rode-bruin ultime, un must pour les amateurs. Balance parfaite, complexité inépuisée après un verre.

Pours dark brown with strong red shine and a small slightly off white head; aroma is lactic sour and fruity, apples and pears, some toasted malt; taste is dark fruits and apple, low to medium sourness, malty and lactic, medium sweet, finish is dry fruity sour with some funk [2012 vintage, barrel 170]

Miltei kirkas, hailakanverenpunainen olut kohtalaisella, mutta melko nopeasti katoavalla vaahdolla. Tuoksu tamminen, happaman viinietikkainen, kirsikkainen ja vaniljainen. Maku hapan, viinietikkainen, kirsikkainen, hieman vaniljainen. Reilun keskitäyteläinen suutuntuma hiilihappoja hyvin vähäisesti. Samalla sekä makean tahmea että kivasti hapan kokonaisuus. Yleensä en tämän tyypin oluista juuri välitä, mutta tässä on kyllä onnistuttu loistavasti! Makeus ja happamuus erittäin hyvässä balanssissa ja tamminen sekä vaniljainen häivähdys tuo kivaa twistiä!

Pours hazy ruby/brown with a medium tan head that is short lasting. Nose is sour cherries, vanilla, oak, wood, tart apple, raspberry. Sweet and very sour flavor. Woodsy, slightly effervescent, chalky mouthfeel. Long sour finish. No burn. The yum.

Bottle, 2010. Pours hazy reddish chestnut, minimal beige head, little lacing. Aroma of oak tannins, cherry, leather, lactic notes, raisin. Flavor is medium tart, light plus funk, oaky, loads of cherry, touch of vanilla. Medium body, soft mouthfeel, low carbonation.

2010 version, 750 ml bottle. Pours a clear orange-amber with a short lived beige head. Aroma is tart, overripe fruit and light roast. Flavor is red berries (cherry, raspberry, strawberry), wood, sugar. Finish is tart, light vinegar. Light to medium body, weak to average carbonation.
Lightly sour, with a pronounced maltiness and a vineous oaky character. Its tasty and hella drinkable, with a complexity that few beers can match. Its damn good.

The body is deep red, bordering on dark brown. A tight off-white head that reminds me of the one youll find on Rochefort 10.
Aromas of red fruits, apples, and brown sugar. Tastes are similar, but with the addition of some slightly boozy raisin bread. There is a sour tartness underlying it all. I cant imagine a more perfect beer.

@ Malt beer festival Nijmegen.
Brown colored beer with a small white cup, low carbonation.
Taste is delicious sour, wood, fruity, caramel, apples, sweet honey.
Great beer.

750ml bottle. 2013 vintage. Deep amber brown colour, off-white foam head and aroma of funk, citrus rind, berries, vinegar sour. Taste is lemon zest, grainy, cherry, dried fruits, sour with caramel, biscuit, apple, oaky notes and a lingering tartness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, tangy sour finish. Very drinkable.

Butelka 375ml. Barwa ciemnoczerwona granicząca z brązem, lekko zamglona, bardzo ładnie się prezentuje. Piana niska, biała, nieźle zdobi szkło. W aromacie nuty octowe, winne i aromaty czerwonych słodkich owoców, wsparte przez nuty drewnianej beczki, dość dobrze wyczuwalne. W smaku początkowo mocny akcent kwasowy ustępujący szybko na rzecz słodyczy, delikatniejszej jednak niż w wersji nieleżakowanej. Jest też bardziej wytrawny. Bardzo wytrawne, aromatyczne i intensywne piwo do delektowania się przez dłuższą chwilę. Polecam.
A sour aroma, pours a hazy reddish brown color with a thin tan head with some lacing. Taste of sour cherries, with a medium and a oily feel with a tart fruit finish.

Poured from a bottle. This is the 2013 vintage. Murky light brown color, small off white head. Sweet and tangy aroma. Medium body with a sweet and sour flavor and a nice sweet finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Heb dit geproefd op een proeverij, het bier kon mij niet echt bekoren. De mix tussen zoet en zuur had beter gekund.

Vintage 2013 - Foeder 149: Aroma is full of surprises. wooden notes, vanilla, red apples a little bit of cherries and other assorted red berry notes. Taste is really divine. Soft and dry, not that sour and stuffed with apples, balsamico, wet wood, soft honey and all over refreshing and exciting. Great stuff!
Very cherry. Long finish is sour, sweet, and balanced. Green apple, sour cherry, a little vanilla cola, and just enough brett to be noticed.
Tap. Light mahogany with small head. Tart with huge cherry. Almost a hint of sweet cola in there. The combination of sourness and smooth is remarkable. Awesome.

Dark brown appearance with little head. Tastes of lime, coriander, sour feet, peppers and malt sweetness. Medium body, somewhat aggressive carbonation and a lasting aftertaste of sour feet. Good if you like sour feet

Botella de @La Maison Belge, Madrid. 28/05/2016
Color rojizo, notas a madera, fruta, final acido, rica rica

2011 barrel 95. 750 ml bottle. The beer is a moderately hazy amber color with a beige head of foam. The aroma has strong dry wine notes and remind me a lot of port. Really nice reddish mahogany colour with no head. Aroma is quite vinegary with some notes of red wine. Taste is fairly tart. Carbonation is pretty low.

Aroma: Essig, Funk, Malz, Rosine, Vanille. Antrunk sauer, Holz, Essignote, sauerfrüchte, Karamell. Halt ein Klassiker.
Clear orange liquid, large head. Aroma of fruits and oak. Medium body, little bit carbonation. Taste is sour, rich and fruity.

Helder bordeauxkleurig bier met gebroken witte schuimkraag.
Aroma: kersen, citroenen, appelen, balsamico azijn, eik, vanille.
Smaak: zoete appels en aardbeien met zure kersen, snoep en citroen.
Gemiddeld mondgevoel met zachte koolzuur.

Muddy brown color with tan head. Aroma has intense balsamic vinegar notes with fermented fruits and some malt in the background. Taste starts sour and acidic but also has malt sweetness with caramel notes. Medium body with high effervescence, quite dry on the aftertaste. A really true to style beer with complex flavors.

Draught at Ale Arsenal. Pours a clear mahogany with a khaki head that lingers throughout and leaves slight lacing. Taste is smooth combination of deep, dark fruit and tartness. Slight woodiness and sour finish. Delicious.

2013. Pours deep mahogany brown with an active brown head, which soon fizzles away. Aroma is cherries, oak, hint of cinnamon, cranberries. Taste is cherry sour, cherry sweet, cinnamon, cranberry sour, medium acidity, sweetishly sour finish.

Rodenbach Vintage 2013
App: Mostly clear burgundy, some chunky particles at the bottom, 2-3 finger dirt white head.
Aroma: cherries, lemons, apples, balsamic vinegar, oak, vanilla, alcohol, slight acetone).
Taste: Sweet apples and strawberries with sour cherry candy and lemon, oak and mild balsamico, vanilla.
Palate: Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, oily texture.
Overall: Could probably do with some age, but its a very nice base beer.

2012 bottle, deep amber beer, big cream head faded. Aroma malt and whiskey, dark fruit, toast. Taste is sour cherries, pineapple, oak, malt, vanilla, something spicy. Palate is smooth and light, carbonation almost bright. This is really amazing. One of the best things Ive ever had!

(2012) Apple, strong and amazing acetic notes, red fruits, amber with beautiful reddish reflections, good white creamy head quite persistant, medium body, high carbonation, perfect sourness, apple and red fruits, acetic notes...vintage is the way in this case.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2016 From cervezasespeciales. In Teku glass. Watching Vikings 4x02. Lots of sediments at bottom. Had to filter it. Acid but can be finished except the bottom. Im starting to enjoy the sourness, as I found myself even liking its smell. Vintage 2012

This corked and caged bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a head of foamy bubbles that were and left behind a light red brown colored body and a very good lacing. The mild aroma was brown malt and sour. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start with a mediumly tingly finish with a lingering aftertaste. The nice flavor contained notes of mild citrus sour oak spices and brown malt. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

Vintage 2011. Pours coppery mahogany with small fizz. Smells both tart and sweet, hints of oak and vanilla. Taste is subtle fruitiness, tartness, oak, vanilla. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and active mouth-carbonation, Rodenbach Vintage 2011 finishes with lingering tartness.

75 cl bottle (2013) from Superalko in Tallinn (the large one on Uus-Sadama street). Was maybe  12. Enjoyed with colleagues. Poured darkish coppery red colour with a beige head that lasted forever. Super lovely aroma of all kinds of good stuff: woody, oaky notes, vanilla, apples, sour cherries and berries... Nice tartness, mellow acidity, quite sweet, faint bitterness in finish. Soft on the palate, woody dry, moderate carbonation. Seemed pretty approachable and not at all extreme in the acidity department. Very nice!
UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 Fresh sweet tasteful ale from 2013. Reddish appearance and cherry aroma. High sweetness and medium sourness. Average carbonation. Medium-full body.
Pours a red copper colour, dominating sour aroma with hints of wood and cherries. Better than the regular Rodenbach and the Grand Cru.
Pours beautifully in reddish-brown almost read. Firm head but small. Balanced sour taste and a rich almst applecidre in the taste with balanced woods and more barrel impressions.

pours unclear dark golden, orange-red tint, with a small off-white cap, some retention and lacing. raspberry vinegar, plums, some sweetness - jammy; nice level of funk, foeder wood, tender spicy tannins, bitter citrus peel. bright to moderate carbonation, medium body - oily; sweet and tart woody-spicy finish. balanced - very good sour with red fruits shining in there.

On tap at The Blackback Pub, Waterbury, VT. 
This was poured into a tulip glass. 
The appearance was a ruddy burnt red/almost brown color. Slim bar pours kind of white head. No lacing.
The smell had soft sweet luscious apples on top of some caramel to toffee, honey and light vanilla. Sourness is light.
The taste seems more sweet than sour through the previously mentioned flavors. Light sweet almost sour aftertaste runs into the finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. 
Carbonation runs fairly light allowing the sourness to penetrate mildly but still some sweetness hits as well. 
Overall, seems closer to a mild Lindemann  s. Sour seems light enough to be a nice one for noobies. Id still have again.
Review from memory, I think I sampled this about a year ago. Tart, cherries, grapes, vinegar. Dry mouthfeel with a very sour aftertaste. Very refreshing.

750ml bottle, 2012 vintage. Reddish brown colour, slightly cloudy, with a thin white head. Tart, sour aroma, a little vinegary even. Taste is tart, sour apple initially, but mellows into oak, toffee and eventually a sweet, fruity finish a little like gummy bears. My first sour red/brown, but wont be the last.

At Mrks. Mrk shares Timos birth bottle I gifted! Reddish amber with ring head. Balsamico, red wine, cherries, sherry, champagne, cinnamon, woodglue, sourdough, wood. Medium sour, light bitter and light sweet. Over medium body, minerallike and velvety smooth. Sparkly strong carbonation. Finish is high sugar sweet and liiiitle dusty. Very nice!

2013 edition, matured for 2 years in Foeder 149. Pours a slight hazed deep amber colour with a copper hue. Light beige frothy head, decent retention and a small creamy ring. Aromas of sourness with sweetness from the grape notes. Hints of cider, balsamic vinegar and wood in the nose. Sour taste, but milder than expected with a wet finish. So, not as tarty. Fruity flavours with cherries and grapes. Not bad, but expected a little more from this one. Feels a little watered down. Maybe too well-blended.

Kolor mahoniowy z rubionowymi refleksami. Piana niska do umirkowanie-niskiej z żółtawym kołnierzykiem. W aromacie nuty stajni, beczki, drewna, wanilii, ciemnych i czerwonych owoców (głównie wiśnie).
W smaku kwaśne, stajenne, dzikie z ponownym wskazaniem na nuty czerwonych kwaśnych owoców. Potem pojawia się spora octowość z posmakami dębiny. Genialne piwo! Zlożone i prrfekcyjnie zbalansowane!
Bottle. Pours a dark red color. Aroma and taste are tart cherries, some oak, and is much better than the regular grand cru.
prachtig biertje, balans tussen zoet en zuur is perfect voor mij. Jammer dat er niet veel van gemaakt wordt.
2012 vintage, 37,5 cl bottle. Light hazy brown to red with a thin head. Red fruits, vinegar, wood. Moderately to very sweet with a moderately sour finish. Thin bodied. OK.

Shared 2012 750 ml. bottle, poured to snifters showing a cloudy, mildly ruby highlighted, walnut color, with a modest layer of light tan head foam, and spots of lacing. The nose was prune juice, dark cherry, tartness, light oaky tannins, and caramel sweetness. Medium bodied, with lively carbonation, and a touch of alcohol presence, the sweet/tart and effervescent spritz balanced very well into the finish.

Bottle, vintage 2013. Red mahogany body with a head that instantly dissipates. Nose is sour, with notes of oak, strawberry, green apple, alcohol and candy bananas. Taste is sour, tangy, vinegary and salty. Refreshing palate, which leads to a dry finish.

2013, lucky barrel 149.
A red flandern where the edge of the throat burn is taken off which I believe is a good idea. Its a lot of similarities to the original grand cru as in dark sweet and sticky on acid but its smoother. Vineager, grapes and that sour in a luxurious package from their lucky barrel no 149. Gotta like it.
-- Instagram Beer.Nerd.Malmo

750ml bottle corked and caged. Dark ruby pour, slightly pink head
Aroma is huge on also in vinegar, ripe berries, sour cherries and some earthy, woody oak. Low carb, full mouth feel. Finish is very very tart, and acidic. Slight lactic note, very woody, hints of vanilla, with a boat load of vinegar and berries. Some age would be interesting.
Dunkel orange braunes Bier mit einer mittelgroßen leicht beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht säuerlich fruchtig, rote Früchte, Karamell. Geschmack fruchtig säuerlich, rote Beeren.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2016 2013 vintage. 0,75 bottle. Ruby red colour. Medium white head ehich disappears quite quickly. Oakiness, cherries, rasperries, cranberries, vinegar in the aroma. Sour cherries at first. Tannines, raspberries in the middle. Sweetness of the other berries in the end. Rather light bodied, very well balanced, refreshing, medium carbonated, absolutely drinkable beer.

2011 vintage. 0,375 bottle. Ruby brown colour. White medium head.  Vinegar, berries, a hints of cognac even. Cranberries and saltiness at first. Sour cherries, redberries in the middle. Acidic finish. A bit of oakiness and berries in the aftertaste. Will raise the overall impression by on point. Convinced.
Tolle farbe! Toller geschmack! Hat sehr gut zu selbstgemachtem tunfischaufstrich mit getoastetem baguette geschmeckt! Getrunken wurde es aus teku gläsern!
Draft (2013 vintage) - Reddish brown color. Sweet with a medium tart flavor. Slight alcohol taste.

Light hazy, dark orange/red colour with medium and quite stable head. Strong aroma of acidic, cherry note, similar to wine note, slightly wood and vanilla on backgorund. Taste is light sweet, light bitter and medium sour/acidic. Finish is medium long and quite acidic and cherry. Medium to full body. Soft to medium carbonation. Very good, complex stuff. Its tastes like mix of good sour beer and wine.

Vintage 2013. Donker roodbruin bier met dunne witte schuimkraag. Geur: framboos, kers, zurig  zoetig. Smaak: zoetig  zurig, kersen. Heel mooi in balans. Het bier vloeit ook mooi zurig uit. Dit bier staat als een huis.

F: pale brown, average, not big, poor retention.
C: reddish to brown, non-transparent.
A: chocolate, wood, earthiness, cherries, red fruits, mild vinous sourness, oak, apple, tobacco, hint of honey.
T: bottle, 2013, very complex taste, dry cherries sourness combined with nice woody tones, crisp vinous with some red fruity, dusty leathery musty, acetone, oak, hint of chocolate, medium body, good carbonated, astonishing beer of this style worth to try.

2011 bottle.
Looks.. Red / brown.. Red mahogany hue, sml head.
Smells..caramel, balsamic, honey, some oak and apple sauce.
Tastes..cherry balsamic immediate tartness, that mellows with green apples and some caramel and a dry oak finish, perhaps the slightest hint of liquorice
Wow. Amazing aroma of pie cherries, barrel, and age. More fruity and yet with a drier finish than the base. Fantastic. This is special stuff. Tasted at 50°F.
Vintage 2013. Great mellow oak aromas, nice dark red and orange hues. Very smooth brew, good balance between sweetness and sour. A really exceptional brew.

Bottle, 2013, Foeder 149. Aroma is citric, yellow fruits and berries, hints of malts, hints of oak, hints of leather, barnyard. Deep reddish brown, clear, medium off white head. Light/medium sweetness, minimal bitterness, medium sour, taste is lemon, lemon zest, raspberry, sweets, sour berries, hints of oak and vanilla. Medium body, soft carbonation, long sour finish. Very complex and rich, delicious!

0.75 l bottle from Alko Arkadia (Special Limited Collection), Helsinki. Brown colour with decent head depending on the serving temperature. When it was cold it felt extremely dry, but later on if was just very dry. Also very complicated taste with oak, fruits, acids and everything. Well, I dont expect you to agree, this just happens to be my favourite beer style.
Orange brown pour, tan head. Aroma cola, cherries slight mustard. TAstes cherries berries, apple cider vinegar, oak. Creamy acidic palate.

2013. Big smell on this beer, pours thick with long lasting tan head. Funky aroma, flavour and aroma both have balsamic but without much tartness compared to the grand cru. Very rich and full bodied, winey, delicious!

Brick Store 2008 tap. Reddish brown appearance with a white head. Aroma contains cherries,, nutmeg, green apples, vinegar. Flavor is somewhat sour with tart cherries at the forefront. This is amazing. No diggity no stout.

Bath from 2013
clear brown beer with low beige head that dont last too long.
Aroma: Dry red wine, apple, apple vinegar, some other sour fruit notes like cherry, red grapes, some barrel flavours like vanilla.
Taste: light sweet, high sour (not as high as some lambics, but still). Flavours similiar as in aroma, with hint of caramel. Long dry finish.
Palate: light to medium body, pretty high carbonation, very dry, very well hidden alcohol.
Overall: Its very good beer. Altough I prefer rodenbach grand cru. Vintage is more dry, flavours from barrel and winish notes are stronger, but grand cru with more sweet have more flavours, there were more going on, it was more interesting to me.

2011 Bottle at home, shared with friends. Clear amber with off white head that quickly disappears. Aroma of oaky vanilla, heavy acetone and cherries. Taste is more fruity with cherries and cranberries, light vanilla and mild tartness.
Smell of oak. Hazy brown colour, small white head. Aroma of sour berries, some alcohol. Sour taste. Half flat carbon, dry palate.

Dark, amber coloured beer with a long lasting, off-white head. Complex aroma with notes of apple, rum, cocosnut, cherry. The taste starts with fruity sourness, tannins. Followed by a long dry aftertaste. A very beautiful, complex beer!
(bottle)(2013) xlear, bright amber colour with a small brown head; aroma of toffee, sourness, wet wood; sour flavour with a long, strong sour finish

Rocznik 2013, w zapachu bardzo intensywnie, kwaśne, winne aromaty. Kolor ciemnobrązowy, klarowne. Piana wysoka, drobnopęcherzykowa, opada do niskiej warstwy, ładnie oblepia szkło. Tap @ William K Kurvi, Helsinki. Pours an auburn red with a stylish, beige head. Aroma is vinegary, oak, sour. Taste is semi-sweet, somewhat sour. Oak, vinegar, acetone, balsamic vinegar, cherry. Smooth.

Bottle, 2013. One finger of light tan head drops slowly to a persistent blanket. Fairly clear deep amber colour. Sour, dark fruit, beautiful mix of acidity with sweetness, tart, dark cherries, over-ripe strawberry, jam, very light oak. Crisp, high carbonation. Medium mouthfeel, med-dry finish. Wonderful lingering mix of sweet and tart. Great complexity.

Bottle, 2012 vintage. Murky dark amber body, medium to small head. Aroma is similar to the regular Rodenbach Grand Cru, only with a sharper vinous edge. Very pleasant tart mouthfeel, taste has cherries, a touch of balsamico and slightly sweet malts. Impeccable balance. As I understand it, this is basically 100% old ale from the huge vats, while the more common Rodenbach Grand Cru contains 1/3 of young ale in it. This is indeed a bit more oaky and more intense, while still maintaining that excellent drinkability.  Lovely sour beer, one of the best ones in this category. It would be hard to suggest any changes to this.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017 Since 2009, this unblended Rodenbach is released yearly in champagne bottles, to celebrate the quality of beer matured in the "best barrel" of each year.  Had nearly every edition but last years release, the "Vintage 2013", drew my specifi attention because of the change in packing (lacquered bottle) and the fact that this one comes from a special foeder, number 149, called "The Sire".  Moussy, pale yellowish beige, bubbly head leaving dots of lacing, slowly dissipating in the middle; hazy burgundy colour with chestnut brownish hue.  Strong, perfumey aroma of maraschino cherries, wet oak, caramel, medlar, sweet sherry, overripe plums, pear juice, maracuja, soaked raisins, cashew nuts, yoghurt, blueberries, young Burgundy wine, purple gooseberries, glue-like solvents and dry earth somewhere, hidden beneath this wealth of dark fruits, sour berries and wood.  Very lively, estery onset, teeming with sourish gooseberries, cherries, plums and passion fruit, but with a sweeter apple-ish core as well; carbonation is softish and perfectly fit for a sour ale, mouthfeel is supple, lean and fluffy at the same time.  The cherry- and plum-like fruit acidity dries the palate till the end, but in perfect balance with the apple-like sweetness and the soft, moelleux caramel malt sweetness underneath, resulting in perfect balance, with yoghurty, lactic tartness all around and integrated into the whole to a degree which is just perfect.  Woody tannins help drying the finish against the apple and caramel sweetness, at the same time releasing lovely retronasal oak flavors (including the classic vanilla), in a lush, utterly elegant way; hops serve only as a virtual background feature, providing structure but no bitterness.  Some gently warming, liqueurish alcohol in the tail carries the wood, the caramel and the lovely fruity esters down the throat.  Flemish red, heralded by this famous brand, was the original sour ale long before the American craft beer movement ventured into this style; it is no coincidence that American sours started off with New Belgium after they had hired a brewer from Rodenbach.  This beer is the epitome of Vlaams rood, as the western Flemish substyle of Flemish sour ale (or oud bruin) is often called: it has clearly been sweetened a bit, more so than the earlier vintages - a comparative tasting would prove interesting - but in this case it does not bother me, as this additional sweetishness is applied in an utterly elegant way and accentuates the underlying caramelly sweetness.  Perfect balance of sweet and sour, generous in its oakiness and packed with lovely fruity esters, this is a classic of international stature and a tribute to the incredible gallery of wooden casks Rodenbach cherishes so much.  This not just Rodenbach, but oud bruin at its best.

20011 Vat 95 -
The beer pours out with a mid-sized head of tanning bubbles the color of white sand dunes. The head has mild lasting qualities, but eventually settles into a thick scrim around my glass. In color, the beer pours a dark burgundy with touches of ruby. Its body is clean and clear of all particles, but it sits seemingly opaque in the glass due to its darkness. On the nose, this beer screams Rodenbach. Tart cherries, malt vinegar, rich oak, vanilla, leather, and even a touch of earthiness flood the nostrils in funky scents. Caramel makes an appearance as the backbone of the smell, providing a sweet, candied bread quality. The oak is really where the nose shines in character, however, with not overpowering richness that bristles with tannins, coats with vanilla, and eases a light toast into the funky scent of the beer. On the tongue, the beer tastes tart and sweet with a mild bitter tannin bringing balance to the beer. The acidity of the beer is most present at the start and close of the sip, while the sweetness seems to sit happily in the sips middle, blanketed towards the end by the bitters. There is superb balance and rich complexity to this beer. In flavor, it begins as rich cherry pie and leather, this opens into funky barnyard, more cherries, and a healthy dose of oak which brings herbal-bitter tannins alongside rich vanilla to the tongue. The finish is sweet with a final hiccup of tart cherry at its close, and lasts beautifully upon the palate, lingering heavily into the aftertaste with sweet cherry and caramel notes alongside touches of scratchy and bizarrely tasty horse blanket and malt vinegar. In the mouth, this beer feels medium in body with a lighter finish. The beer coats the mouth nicely with a mild carbonation, providing light effervescence and levity to the sip. In mouthfeel, the beer has a slightly syrupy pull to the cheeks while remaining smooth. The barrel definitely provides gripping tannins to the cheeks, and the acidity helps to further pull out the cheeks in a pucker. When the beer has left, the mouth is left with a light pool of acid-cancelling spittle and a slight sticky-sweet resin. Overall, this beer is delightfully complex. Rich oak character, fantastic funk, and subtle sweetness blend masterfully in this vintage. Rodenbach is the master of the Flanders Red, and this vintage ale is a perfect example of that. This beer is a delightful blend of everything that makes a Flanders Red a joy to drink. Vat 95 did very well here.

Vinous sour aroma with oak and dark fruit, cherry. Taste is great. Balanced sweet and sour. Cherry, and oaky sweets balanced with the sour. Very full flavored and no sugary sweets. Really a great one from rodenbach. A bit more full flavored and sour than grand cru. Prob 6 of 10 on the vinous scale. Lost carbonation fast, but otherwise great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reddish brown colour with brief, foamy, beige head. Fruity, sour nose with notes of red fruit, sour cherries, red-currant, caramel, oak wood and balsamic vinegar. Fruity, tart taste with sour cherries, blood orange, pink grapefruit, red fruit, raspberries, balsamic vinegar, toffee, caramel and a tart, slightly sweet-and-sour, finish. More than medium body, with a slight sweetness. Quite complex and with lots of character, but in exceptional balance.
Bottle of 2010 vintage, cheers Ben. Cherry cola and lactic tang on the nose. Nice crisp hit of sourness on the tongue, but acetic acid is a little high. Sweetness fits the cola and sourness well.

750 ml bottle into tulip glass; 2010 vintage, best before 2015. Pours slightly hazy dark ruby red color with a 2 finger dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big sour cherry, raspberry, green apple, red grape, oak, clove, red wine vinegar, leather, hay, straw, musty funk, light vanilla, and yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of oak barrel and fruity/acidic yeast notes; with great strength. Taste of sour cherry, raspberry, green apple, red grape, oak, clove, red wine vinegar, leather, hay, straw, musty funk, light vanilla, and yeast earthiness. Moderate amount of fruity tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of sour cherry, green apple, red grape, oak, clove, red wine vinegar, hay, straw, musty funk, light vanilla, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity and balance of fruity/acidic yeast and oak barrel flavors; with a fantastic balance of malt/acidity and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a lightly slick and moderately acidic mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish. Overall this is a fantastic Flanders red ale. All around awesome complexity and balance of oak barrel and fruity/acidic yeast flavors; and very smooth to sip on with the balanced acidity. A highly enjoyable offering.

Brune rougeâtre limpide recouverte dun mince voile qui prend vie au fil des secouées. Un nez acidulé, boisé et même aigre qui est somme toute assez plaisant. En bouche, cest fruité et aussi acidulé, par la lime, ou encore le raisin vert pas encore tout à fait mûr. Cest, au travers certaines gorgées, boisé. Il y a en fin de bouche des élans sucrés. Un arrière-goût qui se prolonge avec des saveurs fruitées. Vintage 2010 Baril No 144 (941-261213)

2009 vintage. Regular beer drinkers at my session hated the stuff but I still loves me a fine Belgian sour ale. The aroma is a nice mix of vinegar and malt, the appearance a nice deep brown. The flavour is a sour mix with beer, a gueuze-like concoction that works just right in the friday night fog. Rodenbach cant do wrong in my books and this is a fine sour ale. But it is not what it isnt: if that makes sense.

Shared bomber with Sherm1016 and others at lake house NYE beer tasting; thanks! Pours a reddish brown; thin head. Tart / cherry taste upfront; both sweet and sour; catching hints of vinegar. Tasty; unusual for me.

---Rated via iPad
A great funky aroma, nice red color. This has a strong funky bite with every sip and a decent fruit flavor as well. Other than the prohibitive price, there is nothing to complain about here.

Vintage 2010 29/12-13. Oklar röd-brun öl med guld-brunt skum. Doft: Malt vinäger, äppel cider vinäger, jord, lösningsmedel, bränt socker, övermogen/rutten citrus. Lösningsmedels doften drar klart ner betyget. Smak: Trä, äppel cider vinäger, multivitamin brustablet, körsbärs kärnor, omogna hallon, rengöringsmedel, jord. Åter igen, tyvärr rengöringsmedel som drar ner betyget.

Lika lite som man avfärdar en huvudrätt som en dålig efterrätt recenserar man Rodenbach som ett öl. Alla förutfattade meningar måste dukas undan om man inte vill duka under i besvikelse. Från lukten av salubrin till smaken av musteri är detta ett bakhåll på sinnena. Om man är i stånd att besvara överraskningen och raskt ställa om sina förväntningar eller om man får skrämsel/fyllehicka och deserterar från denna dessert är en fråga för både samvete och smaklökar. Själv står jag kvar tillräckligt länge för att inse att fienden när allt kommer omkring är en vän, hur cideraktig den än må vara.

2007 Bottle thanks to Frank. Pours a cloudy orange amber with small frothy white head that lasts awhile. The aroma is fruity malt and cherry skins. Medium mouthfeel with cherry tart and oak with light dryness. Very impressive.
Bottle. Dark red witg off white head. Spice woody aroma, funk, Worcester sauce. Taste is a little harsh spicy funk, woody. Quite sour. Nice but a little harsh

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2015 Bottle: 2012 vintage, about 2 years old. Thanks, Josh! Swampy brown body with a very light ruby shimmer to it. Beige cap rests softly on top, sifting to a thin film & chunky collar quickly. Aroma has notes of spicy oak barrel, creamy vanillin, underripe cherry skins, light apple cider vinegar, with a nice, mellow tartness flowing through everything. Vinous, but maybe not as much as Grand Cru. Taste is nice & tart up front with some sour apple, cherry, faint lemon, & oak-y tannins. Vinegar soaked oak staves, nice back-end vanilla, & a somewhat acidic, vinous grape skin finish. Very smooth, nice & tart. Perhaps not as tart as Grand Cru, but the barrel flavors are heavier & more apparent (vanillin, tannin, spiced woody notes). Based on other reviews, two years might be the sweet spot for the vintage series.
Bottle: 2011 vintage, almost 4 years old. Still just as lovely. Lots of spicy cherry skins, tart & acidic lemon, balsamic vinegar, oak, & huge bouts of vanilla. Great stuff as always.
750 mL bottle of 2001 Vintage. Brown with a decent off-white head. Aroma is of tart cherry, plum, oak, lots of fruit. Taste is of cranberries, tart pie cherries, tart raspberry, oak, plum, fruitcake.
7% vintage 2011, shared at Christmas Tasting. Sour nose, vinegar, tart & woodsy. Sour Flemish ale, a tasty sour beer, really nice & drinkable. I will agree with Hypo Luxa 3.6

Aroma is same as any other Rodenbach.
Very nice carbonation. Very sour, nice mouthfeel. Would like to taste this on a vertical tasting.

Coppery color with a light and quickly diminishing head. Aroma is fruity dominated by cherries, also a high presence of wood is present. Flavor is slightly sweet at the beginning, lot of cherries, acidic mouthfeel and wooden notes in the final.

Bottle, 75cl - Clear red brown beer, with a small head. Aroma is fruity with notes of cherries, solvent, nuts and caramel. Flavor is fruity with notes of cherries, citrus, caramel, spices and dates. Love this.

[Vintage 2011, barrel 95] Bottle sample at sour beer tasting at Beer&Beyond shop. Pours clear amber-brown with a nice head. Aroma - sour notes, wood, herbs, grapes. Taste - sour fruits, wood, berries, raisins, pretty tasty. Very good.
Pours an amber brown beer with a good white head. Smells sour, tarted. Tastes sour, bit vinegar. Average carbo, thin body and a watery texture.
Botella. Madera y acidez perfectamente integradas, con frutos rojos de por medio muy sutiles y matizados. Entra muy bien ligera y sabrosa seca dulce y ácida

Bottle. Poured a clear dark brown color with an average frothy tan head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy dark fruit and sour aroma. Medium to full body with a dry smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sour & sweet flavor with a medium to heavy Sweet & sour finish of moderate to long duration. This is another solid beer.
Taster at the Modeste Beer Festival in Antwerp. Very dark red with a bubbly/creamy head on it. Intense sour aroma. Sour, acidic and mature. Decent for its style but not amazing.
2009. Thin lace deep caramel hue. Strange smell with sour notes, oud-brownish. Good, but not for the amount you have to pay for a bottle.

750ml bottle, shared by Ray. 2010 vintage, barrel no. 144. Nice big fruity syrupy sour cherry aroma. Light wood. Good sour taste, and sweetness. Moderately hazy orange copper color. Thin off-white head, couple loose dots of lace. Smooth, crisp lighter carbonation. Good tingly sour tannins in the finish. Awesome sour brown ale.

750 ml snifter (2010 Vintage; shared by Ray). Looks good; A semi-transparent reddish-brown with off-white lacing. Smells good too; tart and a little funky with notes of oak and cherries. Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel. Good beer!

2011 bottle, 75 cl from Systembolaget. Clear red Brown with a thin beige head. Cherries, raspberries, ripe strawberries, nice sourness, quite a bit of sweetness. Medium body, high carbonation, soursweet finish. Very nice!
2010 bottle. Brownie dark. Aroma is malt caramel. Taste is vinegar sweet, tart and tangy. Overall nice beer, but not as much as I was expecting.

Pours very dark reddish brown with a small beige head. The aroma has dark cherries, good amount of oak, mild tartness, blackberries, raspberries and lots of brightness. It has a medium body that is quite crisp and has a modest amount of sharp carbonation. The flavor starts with oak, tartness, cherries, vanilla, spice and vinegar. The finish has a mix of richness and tartness. Excellent.

2010 bottle at home from drinkstore
Slightly hazy deep crimson with offwhite lacing. Tart cherry and woody notes on nose, medium carbonation, sweet at first with red wine vinegar, balsamic umami and a building citric/lactic acid sourness resulting in a complex yet drinkable release.
2011 bottle. Good but nothing special. Too sweet and not sour enough for me. Not a bad beer at all but for $21 a 750 I cant see buying again. If you like sweeter Flanders Reds, its worth a try.

750ml bottle @Cimmeria. Sour, caramel, wood aromas. Pours hazy copper-reddidh, with nice tan head, vanishing, some lacing. Light body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is a good combination of sour flavours, kind of lively, with more mature, wood, liquor like ones. Balanced and very enjoyable.

Bottle (750 ml). Vintage 2010. Slightly hazy amber with a beautiful medium dense and mostly lasting beige head along with some lacing. Aroma is typical of Rodenbach beers, but is so refined. Theres a lot of red fruits (especially cherries), oak, vanilla, sharp acetic notes, caramel and a nice earthy presence. Taste is also of red fruits, oak, vinegar, caramel and vanilla. Medium body. Moderate/medium carbonation. Dry finish. Very complex and tasty. Great balance. Amazing beer!

vintage 2011,37.5cl bottle. poured a dark red / brown colour with a creamy head. cherries red wine, , vanilla, oak, some apples, caramel, nice oak flavour, bit sourness but not overwhelming. nice sipper.

Pours lightly hazy amber with a tight, creamy off-white head. Nose gives of some dry fruit notes but still has some juicy berries and modest tang. Medium sweet flavor with tangy berries, sweat, light alcohol, raspberry.
Bottle (2011 vintage) - Copper in colour. Cherries, damp wood, fruitcake and spice in the aroma. Tart, sharp and fruity taste with notes of cherries, caramel, leather and some acidic, musty hints.

Nice brown red almost clear pour with well sized head. Nose is sour cherries, vinous, some balsamic vinegar too. Taste of sour cherries again and unripe red fruits, tart. On the back theres a hint of the oak. Mouthfeel is dry and sparkling. Overall a very good and refreshing beer. Try it!!
Bottle from utobeer. Reddish brown, small tan head. Aroma is tart with red fruits. Quite a nice tart and fruit flavor with a medium malt backing. Very nice beer.
2009 - Slowbeer 750ml (26-Oct-13) Big sweet sour cinnamon malt aroma. Big sweet rounded cherry fruit sour malt. Sour cherry tangy cinnamon finish and cherry sour cinnamon aftertaste.

Cinnamon herbal hop malt aroma. Brown colour with poor head And lacing. Sour cherry malt herbal flavour. Flat palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vintage 2007. A very ugly beer. Aroma is some sourness, sweet red fruits and berries. Taste is pretty much the same but in my opinion, it lacks tartsness. A fine beer, but it seems to be too old now, If you have it, crack now! A little disapointed

2009 vintage bottle- murly reddish brown, two finger thick head and lacing. nose- cherry, malt vinegar. taste- a balance of sweet and sour with a vinegar kick on the finish. Oaky aftertaste with just enough sour punch to leave the mouth watering for more. Pretty easy drinking actually.

750 ml bottle from Binnys South Loop (Chicago, IL). 2011 Vintage Bottling. Finally decided to splurge on this guy. Pours a deeper reddish brown hue, some decent darker middle muddles the glow a bit as the edges show more orange red color, some nice glow. A frothy beige head atop dies to a thinner film, loose with mellow lacing. Aromas are big berry flavors, offering rich black and red sour cherries, firmer tartness meets some pie sweetness. Cherryskin, touches of pulpy berry. Firm to big wood presence shows tannic dryness, wet wood, and some gentle vanilla. Gentle Balsamic vinegar, a bit dry and tart. Not bad, offering some bigger, assertive elements. Initial is a bit diffferent, turning the corner to a big fruit presence, lots of apple, touches of vinegar, sour red fruit shows cherry, raspberry, and some jammy sweetness. Lots of oak meets these flavors, dry and tannic, some vanillin enters the equation. Sweet as a firm big fruity element meets those brown and red malts. Some lactic elements start to kick as we turn the corner, more funk and leather elements, some biscuits, some gentle vinegar qualities meet up, touches of brown sugar, brown malt, earthiness. Dark and dried fruit mix liberally as we start to taper out. Still a bit sweeter than Id personally like, offering tangy fruit elements, berry and cherry, as we start to finish. A bit tannic, still too sweet, and some sourness kick and finish off. The brett really doesnt get going till we hit the backend, a bit of basement, horseblanket, and subtle dried sweat. This is solid. Its a bit too sweet for me personally, but it really goes through the ringer.

2011 vintage. Magnificent sour - easily topping the already stupendous Grand Cru by virtue of its extra bite and refreshment value alone. The usual heady balsamic / blood hit but with an extra kick in the middle of the mouthful - a great bitter dryness that sizzles the palate delightfully. Vinous, barnyard, berry. Just beautiful.

Wow. The initial is highlighted by a sharp sour cherry that would certainly pucker the lips of the most ardent sour lover. After the initial, other notes include woody oak, a hint of vanilla, and a modest note of the acidity of vinegar. Sour cherry fades to dry oak in the finish.
nah, couldnt do it. Chemical aroma, took forever to open up, a clear worst in a blind taste test. rotten flavors.
Bottled. Vintage 2010. Not overly complex. Some residual sugars in the finish. A bit dissapointing.

Bottle from Total Wine in Boca Raton, Fl. Snifter. Pours a reddish-brown with a nice thick head. Some lacing. Aroma of tart cherries and blackberries, some funk and yeasts. The taste is tart cherries, funk, slight sweetness of the fruits, and floral notes. Medium body. Love the tartness. I have a 2009 so hopefully it is even better.

The nose has a nice tart cherry aroma, with some port wine. Darker than the regular Rodenbach, if I remember correctly. The extra oak-aging has given it more body. The sweetness has mellowed somewhat, but thankfully the sourness is still right there, and it picks up in the finish. This has all the depth of a great red wine, with some acidity, sour cherry, Belgian yeast, and a hint of raspberry. Spectacular.
One of my favorite Sour Browns, very complex and fruity with a great tart but not overwhelming sour finish. Love this stuff!

Bottle at Kulminator: Rodenbach 2007 Vintage Oak Aged Ale, Barrel No 230 Limited Edition. Reasonably clear dark amber with noticeable carbonation, good white head that leaves done nice lacing. Aroma is balsamic vinegar, sour cherries, sour plums, dried cranberries, raisins, earthy wood. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel, sweet and sour on the palate, little sourness in the throat as it goes down. Taste is plums, sour cherry, raisins, prunes, grained mustard, strawberry yoghurt, hint of balsamic vinegar. Delicious!
Sampled from a bottle at Where the Wild Beers Are. Cherries and mild vinegar, sweet tasting. Nice beer.
2011 bottle from local supermarket. Nice brown colour. Refreshing, Hints of cherries. very nice.
2008 Vintage bottle at Buffalo Beer Geeks Fest 2013. shimmery sherry red pour, red wine features, vinegary, tart, dark fruits, quite tart & sour. nice

(Bottle. Vintage 2008) Reddish brown colour with brief, foamy, beige head. Fruity, sour nose with notes of red fruit, sour cherries, red-currant, caramel, oak wood and balsamic vinegar. Fruity, tart taste with sour cherries, blood orange, pink grapefruit, red fruit, raspberries, balsamic vinegar, toffee, caramel and a tart, slightly sweet-and-sour, finish. More than medium body, with a slight sweetness. Quite complex and with lots of character, but in exceptional balance. Lovely beer!

Bottle @ Croydonia. The pours reddish brown. Small head. The nose is rich red berry jam. Cherry compote. Some wood. Tart pear. The taste is dirty pennies. Earthy unwashed red fruits. Mild tangy acid. Bright strawberry on the finish. Burnt brown sugar. Medium body, soft carbonation. Overall, really nice.

750 ml bottle. Vintage 2010
Pours a dark red brown with little head.
Aromas of wood dark fruit and cherries.
Smooth. Thick dark cherry flavor with a little wood and vinegar. Still lots of fruit an still a little sweet.

Ruby body with off white head. Sweet cherries and dried fruit aroma. Bready and vinous. Taste is quite sweet like a fruity whiskey a touch of barley wine to this as well. Oaky. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks a tonne Northropfrye for this.Incredible. Pours copper with ruby highlights great aromas of sour cherry and some sweet bubblegum. Flavours are sour cherries and bubblegum and some nice oak notes. Absolutely delicious.

Bottle - Vintage 2007 @ Sur Smagning Mashup Beer Festival. Pours clear hazel with a small brown head. Aroma is delicate and complex with lots of lactic - yogurt, oak, quite a lot of cherries, caramel, paper/bread, light funk and light balsamic vinegar. Taste is moderate sweet, light bitter and light+ tart. Body is medium, texture is oily/fatty, carbonation is moderate. Finishes fruity sweet and lactic tart. Duften fik mig til at tænke på tykmælk med frisk rugbrødsdrys!

Mash-up. Dark mahogany. Haze. Intens vinory. Stale oak in a very pleasant form. Brandy mouthfell. Very complex. Love it
Bottle. Red with thin white head. Aroma of cherries and vinegar. Taste adds apple, oak and earthiness. Sticky mouthfeel. Awesome and complex.
Bottle 2010. Poured dark red with cream colored head. Apple vinegar sour aroma. Med carb. Super sour taste. Different.

Wow. My love of sour beers continues! Appearance is reddish brown. Aroma is vinuous, full of oak, cherries, citrus, somewhat dank and funky. Flavor is a bright cherry, with grape, and tart fruit.
