04-13-2013

2010 bottle sample as a bonus beer at the Upland tasting at Blacklick Wine & Spirits on 7/25/13. Clear copper pour with a thick tan head. Big sour aroma with notes of oak, cherry and pepper. Sweet cherry flavor with some vinegary tartness before a sweet maple finish.

2007 Vintage from Corvallis Homebrew Supply.  Mahogany with film of tan head which quickly fades to a placid surface with low effervescence. Aroma of honey, caramel, vinegar, grass and pine forest, raisin bread. Light body with low, fine carbonation. Flavor of honey, apple cider/vinegar, a hint of grassy resin. smooth sweetness and restrained sourness compared to the Grand Cru. A good summer Flanders. Great.

Bottle at the Croydonia Tasting - East Croydon. Thanks to Jack for pulling this 2009 Vintage from his cellar. Pours lightly hazy amber with a tight, creamy off-white head. Nose gives of some dry fruit notes but still has some juicy berries and modest tang. Medium sweet flavor with tangy berries, sweat, light alcohol, raspberry. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Light jammy fruit finish with further sweaty berries. Good.

My bottle shared at RBAG 2013. 2009 vintage. Reddish orange pour. Hazy. Holds a thin ring of white head. Winey nose, tangy, some red berry notes, vinegar, fruity. Taste is sour and woody with rich red wine notes. Ends dry and woody. Nice complexity, very drinkable and a great value at under 15 bucks for the 750. Would be happy to drink this anytime.
Has the intense sourness of the Grand Cru, but with a soft touch to it. Making it a very balanced and complex brew. A feast for the senses.

Bottle, shared at RBAG 2013. Murky red-brown body with an off-white head. Aroma is spicy vinous malt with woody undertones. Richly malty palate, port-like fruits and caramel, moderate sour character with lovely spice and wood in the finish. An archetypical Flemmish sour; beautiful.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle - Sour dark fruits and brown sugar. Barrel notes are there as well. Caramel colour, cloudy with a thin head. Sour dark fruit and barrel notes, with a spicy finish. Really nice Flanders.
2009 Vintage - Great balance of sweet and sour with high acidity and more sour flavors than the traditional Rodenbach. Has nice flavors of tart cherries and sweet tarts.

Bottle [750ml] shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, jercraigs & mabel -- c/o GregClow. 2009 vintage. Pours a hazy orange-amber with an average size frothy off-white head. Nice aroma of sour fruit foremost along with some vinegar and yeast. Flavour is sour and tart along with some light spices, oak and lactic notes. Medium bodied. Fantastic stuff!
2009 vintage. Fantastic aroma on this. It has that classic sour cherry feel on the palate, but also has what seemed to be like a sweet olive characteristic. Surprisingly bright and fizzy.

2013-06-28. Hazy red brown body with a small off white head. Aroma has a sour cherry like quality to it, lactic sourness, very light accent of leafy vegetation like character. Flavour is pleasantly sour, lactic, sweetish fruity middle, lingering mild lactic sourness throughout. Smooth average plus bodied palate, carbonation. Fairly subtle, pretty nice. Bottle shared by GregClow

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2013 Fantastisk doft av ljusa röda bär med en lockande chokladton. Det finns även -i andra andningen-en ytterst lätt ton av grönmögelost. Smaken emotsäger doften vid första intrycket;den är mycket syrlig med tydlig citronkaraktär. I andra smakvågen känner man både de röda bären och chokladen. Avslutet är runt,mjukt och faktiskt sött

2009 vintage. Murky dark amber, with a fine edge lacing. Sweet/sour aroma, hint of oak, sweat, tart dark fruits, sweet malt, vinegar. Taste is initially too sweet for my liking, but then the tartness, along with a slight toffee-apple sweetness, really breaks through and semi cleanses the palate, leading to a nice puckering bitter sweet flavour; comes across like a well made scrumpy! Good carbonation tickles the tongue on all sides. Long, bittersweet, drying finish leaves you wanting a little more.

2007 bottle at a bottle share. Aroma is typical Rodenbach with oak, cherry and iron coming through. Pours pink with brown film. Tast is way too tart to the point of vinegar. The oak notes are there but the cherry and caramel get lost. I was not a fan.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2014 Balsamvinäger. Krämig och härlig. Läskande. Bra syra. Påminner mycket om Grand cru. Tanniner och viss strävhet.

------&  2011 barrel 95. Riktigt elegant och den här är plötsligt en nivå bättre än Grand cru. Härlig komplex balsamvinäger.

Bouteille de 750ml. 2010 fût 144.  Bière rouge-brun avec une mousse brune peu durable. Le nez est balsamique, empyreumatique, acide et une peu lactique. La bouche est boisée, empyreumatique, balsamique, une sorte de vinaigre de xérès mais en bière, lacidité fait saliver. Superbe.

Bottle at unibaren, 15 / 6 2013. Vintage 2007. I had no idea what to expect. Dark brown red, white ring. Aroma, malty sweet, sour, red friuts. Taste, I was really surprised, malty wine up front, and then sour, and I like it. Best sour Ive had.

2008 Vintage.  Pours a dirty brownish red with a small quickly disappearing white head.  Aroma is vinegar, farmy and wet blanket.  Taste is tart, wet blanket, somewhat floral and an overall oak dryness and wood.  Fantastic.

2009 Vintage. Sampled from a 750 ml brown bottle this beer poured a hazy red-tan color with a small foamy tan head that left a bit of lacing. The aroma was sweet, tart and tangy cherries, raspberry, vinegar and soy sauce. The flavor was very tart, tangy and bitter with a strong sour cherry, raspberry and vinegar presence. Long tart and sour cherry and berry finish. Medium body. Nice.

2010.  Fût numéro 144.  Vintage est un liquide rougeâtre qui montre, au départ, un beau collet mousseux.  Le nez de ce brassin est à la hauteur de mes attentes.  Le chêne fait un travail remarquable. Les notes fruitées sont douces et perdent des parfums aigres très intéressants.  Le côté malté est complexe, voire même riche.  Ça sent bon.  Les saveurs sont celles dun vin de fruits aigres de grande qualité.  Le foudre de chêne et les malts sont des parfumeurs redoutables: les notes boisées et caramélisées sont enrobantes et apportent une richesse extraordinaire et un sublime équilibre.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps de moyenne densité.   Le pétillement est doux et la texture huileuse.  La finale est un habile mélange de notes aigres qui attaquent doucement les tissus de ma langue.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2015 Fra flaske på Cardinaltreff 2.pinsedag: etter mange middle of the road denne kvelden dukket den første höjdaren opp i form av denne - takk til Sigmund som hadde gjemt unna noen flasker av 2010-utgaven! Mine notater sier bare voj, voj, denne har alt - frukt, bær, sødme, syre og friskhet, alt harmonisk avrundet. Min dannelsesreise innen surøl fortsetter! Bottle shared with The Bergen tasting crew, and Gunnar. Vintage 2007. The colour is hazy dark amber, and has a light beige medium head. Wonderful aroma of wood, oak, bitter berries, rowanberries, cherries and lots of spices. The flavour is fantastic with both sour and sweet berries, and vanilla, wood, leather and something that reminds me of sherbet. Has a soft and slick mouthfeel, and a light berry bitterness. A wonderful and well-balanced beer with sweet berries in every corner.

deliciousness has now got a name... keep getting surprised by rodenbach, and together with the caractere, these are my favourites. all the good parts of rodenbach combined, and extra prominent. caractere withoud the fruit, just solid, stable, VERY nice thing. and to say this is supermarketbeer? ill buy them all !

Shared bottle at BBGTC tasting. Pours hazy reddish/amber with a small white head. Aroma is wood, berries, balsamic vinegar and sweet caramel. Taste has a good tart freshness, smooth palate, a tasty and complex one.
bottle at bow ... copper ... thin off white head ...soft tart balsamic nose ... zezty sour fruits ... fruity ... soft balsamic  ... juicy ... quite tart linger ... quite a wooody linger ...
On tap in 2010 at Pizza Paradiso in DC. Aroma and flavor was just superb as I remember it.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2012 Bottle 750ml vintage 2007 barrel 230 @ Ølkonsortiet, Aalborg
Pours slightly hazy amber with a off-white head. Aroma has sour notes of malt, fruity, caramel and oxidization. Body is medium sweet and light to medium sour with a long fruity and dry finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2012  Vintage 2009. Appearance was cloudy orangish amber with creamy tiny diminishing off white head, no lacing. Aromas are belgain candi, plum, fig,  cherry, sherry, mikd oak. Taste was sour flemish soft cherry, plum, oak,  sherry, funky yeasts, slight honey and alcohol. Palate was soft creamy CO2 with slick full body, lasting sour fruit oak sherry smooth finish. A beauty...
(From notes 6 Oct, 2012) Bottle. 2010. Quite complex, bitter. Aftertaste is sour, mouth-drying. Perhaps I havent learned to appreciate oak-aged beers yet. Not really my thing (yet).

75cl bottle. 2010, barrel number 144. Dark red/brown with medium, thick, and slightly reddish head. Nose : attacking aromas of sour cherry, wood, tart, booze, smoke. Sip : oily texture with low to medium body, tingling carbonation. Wonderful sweet start with strong cherry and red grape flavor. Strong tart followed by fruity sour. Aftertaste revives apple notes. Wood and booze is well balanced into this rich, fruity sour ale. Wonderful ! I dont enjoy much sour ales or lambic but this one is really good.
200711: Reddish color with a fine beige foam. Mysterious tart/woody aroma and taste.
Bottle. 2008. Pours reddish brown. Nose/taste of light vinegar, cocoa, sweet caramel, oak, overripe cherry skins and all and nutmeg. Medium body. Moderate acidity. Well-balanced.
Tap at de koffer groningen. Dark anber small off white hesd. Ffuity aroma also fruits and sours in ghee taste and palate. Peculiar brew nut unpleasant rather nice!

2008. Banana bread, nutmeg, cinnamon, fruit- almost sweet tart aroma. Supremely well balanced- smooth, tart, not too sour, cherry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2009. Murky red-brown body. Thin skim of pinkish head. Overripe cherries, vinous notes, oak and faint acetic notes. Medium to light bodied. Incredibly easy to consume. A classic.

Pours a soft ruddy brown with two fingers of sandy tan head.  Sticky lace.  Awesome nose.  Lightly acidic with notes of cherry and caramel.  Overtly vinous with a bright acidity over hints of wood. Spicy oak and tart cherry notes. Very acidic palate and spicy oak on the finish.

2009... Pours a deep red brown with a smaller head... flavors of cherry fruits dominate a more sweet than sour flavor profile and the aroma is similar... dryish finish, the sourness is subtle relative, and the fruitiness is more pronounced than expected... medium bodied...

Bottle shared with Matt, courtesy of Thorpe429. Thanks Mike! 2008 vintage. 

A: Hazy, reddish brown color with very little head. The head hastily withers to a thin, wispy layer and leaves virtually no lacing.

S: Sweet malts, toffee, alcohol, an atypical scent that must be brettanomyces. I am quite unfamiliar with brett in this context, and find this beer quite intriguing.

T: The beer is decent tasting. The flavor is unusual, but not off-putting, like I feared. Of course, its malt heavy with some nice toffee notes. Bourbon comes through in the finish.

M: Medium bodied with fairly low carbonation and warming alcohol in the finish.

D: A fun and interesting beer. Id have this again. This is a good bottle to share a few ways.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-02-2011

Bottle shared by badnewsbeers. Deep red-orange-brown translucent body, thin creamy head. Nose of vinaigrette and cheese rind funk. Sour, tart body, with vinaigrette, phenols and slight oxidation. Solid balance of sweet and sour notes.

Pours deep murky brown with minimal head.  Smells of strong vinegar, apples, caramel, and fruit.  Taste is non-offensive tart and figs.  Nice rich palate with sour aftertaste.  An excellent sour.  2008 vintage.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The Aroma is amazing... multifaceted and full of surprises. (Tart, fruity [cherry? Apple?], some spice from the oak, a little bit of cheese, slight bit of dough). The flavor is thought provoking and beautiful, but accessible.  The only perfect score Ive given.

Sean says: "what Yuletide must have been like before Santa Claus.  The flavor unfolds like a time lapse of a sapling turning into a tree."

MMMmmmm, Yum! Great sweet tart beer!  Poured at  a good temperature with smallish, foamy, light tan head that settles after a bit and a smidgen of lace. Color is a clear honey amber with a couple of bubble trails. Aroma is cider, caramel, fruit, malt, yeast. Flavors like nose with excellent sweet/tart balance, with a little bitter to round out the picture. Body is great and carbonation perfect. Finish is like flavor, long, and superbly drinkable. Almost want to gulp it, so good.

2009 bottle at Denis. Deep red, hint of brown, thin white head. Toasted barley, balsamic vinegar, caramel, red fruit nose. Dry, tart, soft raspberry, some honey malt hints, vinous sourness, juicy fruity sourness on the finish. Lovely.
2008 Vintage. Nose: Vinegar, barley, raspberry and brown sugar. Aroma: Raisins, sour notes, marshmellows, red-wine vinegar and oakbarrel notes

Barrel 96, 2008 edition.  Wow.  This is awesome.  Murky blueberry juice purple-red.  Thin, glass lacing head...rising CO2 bubbles. Mellow, oaked cherry aroma.  Vinegar sourness, with a sweet cherry thing going on as well.  Really quite a phenomenal beer, this is as good as any sour out there.  Delicate yet massive, bitingly sour with interesting faint vanilla oak tones peaking through. Enough depth that you want to sip at it forever.  World Class beer all the way.  Sour cherry aftertaste, sticky and long lasting.  Completely phenomenal, worth the steep admission.

Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden.
Fine aroma that almost goes as far as a Geueze, just a tuch smoother. Same old taste as the normal Rodenbach just a bit more and more complex. Semi dry and nice acidity. Big red fruit taste.

From a 75cl v.2009 from barrel number 145. 
Wonderfull dark ruby red color with a nice thick beige head that lasts long time.  Aroma is powerfull fruity and woody.  Flavors is sour red fruits, nice pleasant strong sourness, vanilla, raisains, oakcomplex flavors.  Nice carbonation, refreshing, very tasty.  Really special brew.  wonderfull.

5/20/12 from rudy (#3) rodenbach gc 2008. 

Murky reddish copper

Very cheesy,graham cracker,white mold,cookd cherry,very much like alexander...balsamic, much sweeter than sour but quite funky. Takes about an hour to really come around....8+/4/8+/4/17

29th December 2009ChrisO Night Of The Gaylords tasting. Clear brown beer. Light sourish nose, a little vinegary. Soft light palate. Nice sour beer. Duchesse Du Bourgogne but lighter and softer. Pretty good.
UPDATED: MAR 3, 2014 The best kind of Rodenbach I tasted! Very well balanced. Aroma of sour fruit and  balsamic vinegar. Sour, fruity and some sweetness. Fantastic!

Geruch mit Holzfass-Noten (Eiche), säuerlich. Startet mild-säuerlich. Im Mittelteil holzig, Ananas, Vanillearomen. Abgangs zieht die Säure an, wird aber (zum Glück für mich) durch eine gewisse Süße überlagert. Trocken abgehend - Gut.

Best beer l have had in a good while. Pours a beautiful amber with a red hue. The head has a slight pink tint. The aroma is sour cherries with some oak over a malt sweetness. The flavor is similar with a sweet and sourness that would make a Chinese chef jealous. The finish is extremely dry and refreshing. My bottle was from 2009 and from barrel number 145.
2009 vintage bottle, 750ml. Pours hazy rusty oud bruin, nice acidic nose, some wood, lots of saliva. Really a great oud bruin.

Draft at Klooster, Delft.  Pours a murky brown with a small tan head.   Aroma of sour cherries, caramel and balsamic vinegar.  Sour cherries, caramel and dark fruits in the flavour with a quick tart finish.  Low carbonation.  2008 Vintage.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2013 2006 and 2008 Vintage bottle) Pour is ruby with an off white head..Nose is sour skittles, sugar, sweet tarts, cherry, lemon..Taste is sour, tart, wood, sour cherries, acidity..Palate is tart and sour..Wow, love this stuff

750ml bottle - 2007 vintage.
Deep red brew with a creamy off-white head.  Nose is crazy sour/funky with cherry and tons of oak.  Tastes as good as it smells - woody with cherry and other dark pitted fruits.  Easy drinking with a terriffic linger.

Vintage 2007. Pours a clear and brown beer with a weak offwhite head. The aroma is fruit, acidity, malt and wood. The flavor follows the nose with additional sweetness. The palate is sweetness. Overall this is a good beer.
Pours cloudy copper with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, fruit, sour and light oak. Flavour is caramel, fruit, sour and oak. Nice.

2009 vintage bottle with a big thanks to phaleslu. tried next to rodenbach cereal, also with a bigtime thanks to phaleslu.   most familiar with rondenbach grand cru though, so ill compare it to that.  compared to rodenbach grand cru this has a brighter lactic yogurt acid cherry sourness.  less cocoa and chocolate covered cherries.   some pleasant wet oak. dry mouthfeel.    easy drinkin.   nice beer.

750 ml bottle from michael-pollack- thanks again, Pollack! 2009 Vintage. Pours a nice copper color with a big off-white head. Notes of sour cherries, caramel, oak, brown sugar, and balsamic vinegar. Light-medium bodied, with a sweet, sour mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Really nice traditional sour in the Flanders Red vein.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2012 fris zuur met brede zoetheid, met smaak diepte van appel en caramel, hout en vanille,complex en in balans.
2008 bottle thanks to stephanie @ the bottle shop.  Nose is wood, sour, bugs, cherries, very sour.  Smooth palate, great notes of oak, sour, lightly acidic, excellent.

75 cl bottle vintage 2008 @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated on 22.03.2011
Aroma is rather strong and stale with oaky notes and sour cherries. Feels like a gym with air conditioning broken. Flavour is somewhat refreshing with oaky notes, sour cherries. The sweetness almost ruins the show.
Courtesy of ratebeef! Clear amber pour and a small white head. Nose of red wine, oak, light vinegar and hint of fruity malt. Tart grape and oak with some definite sweetness to it. Damn tasty.

pours foggy brown with a low thick head
nice aromas of sour tones, oak (of course), grapefruits, belgian yeast ans hints of sweet fruits.
excellent palate with a fine sour tone, fills you mouth very well, nice long ending.
really good sour ale!

2009 Vintage. Pours amber with a firm 2 finger tan head. Cherry, musty cellar, and vinegar sourness in the aroma. Pleasingly tart, very drinkable sour lactic with a nice creamy mouthfeel and soft carbonation. I need to get another few bottles and hold it longer I think it might get even better.

Bottle @ hotel room, Ithaca. 2008 vintage. Cloudy, brownish red appearance with a small tan head. Rich cherry, dark berry, somewhat oaky, tart, somewhat acidic, vinegar aroma. Pretty tart, vinegar, big cherry, red fruity, somewhat oaky, quite fruity flavor with a dry finish. Pretty delicious.

750 ml bottle bought @ Etre Gourmet. 2007 vintage. Pours reddish brown with a small off-white head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace. Smell is sour and slightly sweet with wood, burnt sugar, plums, gooseberries, dark grapes, raisins, vinegar and hints of horse blanket. Taste is sour and slightly sweet with burnt sugar, cherries, plums, red grapes, wild strawberries, vinegar, wood and berries. Mouthfeel is tart and full-bodied. Finish is tart and dry with vinegar, burnt sugar and fruit. Extremely drinkable, balanced and good!

75 cl bottle, pours dark brown with very little carbonation, aroma of malt, cherry, acetone, vinegar and wood, taste follows the nose,fairly tart, very reminiscent of the Granc Cru, very good overall.

Sampled at the First Inaugural Raleigh Rare and Vintage Beer Festival.  Claimed as the only keg of 2008 vintage in the US.  Murky amber pour with good khaki head.  Good tartness on the aroma.  And the flavor has a lingering cherry sweettarts quality.  Slightly acidic.  Very pleasant easy drinking sour, that wasnt fake.
Bottle from Belgisk Bryg. Dark reddish colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, spice, fruit, wood and vinegar.

2007 bottle from Utobeer. It pours murky brown, with a quickly dissipating beige head. The nose is malt vinegar, soft stewed fruits - strawberry, plum, cherry and wood. The taste is tangy cherry, strawberry, raspberry, wood and some malt vinegar, with a tangy finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Very drinkable and well balanced, not nearly as much malt vinegar as the Grand Cru.
Bottle picked up at Barley Wine Copenhagen. 2007 version. This is one of the best beer Ive had. Wish I could get more of this stuff!

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2016 Vintage 2007.from Beer Planet. Long Acid and fruit finish, Ale sie dzialo kwasno dziko, zywiolowo, bardzo owocowo, zurawina dzika lesne jagody, pozeczki czarne i czerwone i mnostwo wisni. Kwaskowy posmak, wytrawne niebywale czasami to az usta sie krzywily i wolaly o jeszcze. Ciemno bordowa barwa ze znikoma, a praktycznie zerowa piana. Bliskie do wytrawnych najbardziehj szlachetnych win. Na zakonczenie pozostawia wisniowo balsamiczna lepkosc w ustach. Classic and Powerfull Sour Ale.

Bottle, 2009, barrel 145. Pours a clear dark ruby red with a white head. Smells tart, of cherries, some Brett, sweetnes. Tastes of tart cherries, wood, heavy sweet, medium tart, medium sour. Medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Finishes a pleasant tart. Very well done.

Oh man, this was good. Nice mix of cherry, oak, and citrus on the nose. Flavor is pretty much the same. More fruit, like blueberry or blackberry as warms. Hints of balsamic vinegar, as well. 2009 Vintage. I will be getting more...

Pours a hazy dark amber colour with a white lasting head. Sour tart notes on the nose followed by black cherry, apple and earthiness. Taste is complex, tart cherry, caramel, some malt, ripe red fruit, slight vanilla note. Im really pleased I got a bottle of this. Superb.

Bottled 750ml (vintage 2008, "barrel no 96")
Hazy red color, small off-white head. Earthy, tart, fruity aroma. Medium-bodied. Tart, fruity, balsamico, cherries, wood. Balanced, fruity and tasty. Not far from normal Rodenbach. Classic.

2008 Vintage, 750ML corked and caged poured into goblet.  Appearance is brown with a fizzy, white head.  Smell is of sour cherries, vinegar, oak.  Taste is of slightly soured cherries and raspberries with a little funk.  Mouthfeel is crisp and refreshing with medium carbonation.  Im fairly new to Rodenbach but this is the best one Ive had.  Its not overly tart and maintains a nice balance of sour with hints of fruit and oak.  Theres about 5 more bottles at the store I bought it from and I will be returning there soon to buy a couple more.

2008 bottle. Pours red-brown with a pinkish head. Aroma has got notes of strawaberries, ammonia. Its quie vinous and earthy. The taste is sweet a first. Strawberries and powder sugar. Some wood in the aftertaste. Medium sourness. very drinkable,

750ml bottle in a snifter.  Pours cloudy amber/brown with a lacy, light beige head.  Aroma of oak, sourness, brown sugar, some spiciness, a little bit of fruit, and some floral hops.  Flavor of this beer is incredible.  A smooth, but bubbly texture.  One of the best beers Ive had in this category.

2009 bottle from Fermentation Market ($18).  Murky brown pour with a big fluffy light tan head.  Aroma is pleasant mix of wood, oak, caramel, cherry, green apple and acidic.  Tastes are lightly tart cherry, acidic, green apple, berries, vinegar, brown sugar and oak.  Finishes dry with a spike of tartness.  Good.
2008 Vintage. Love the oak in this beer...complements the deep sour flavors very well. Great mouthfeel, deep layers of fruit and oak make it tasty all the way from nose to lingering finish.
Red brown colour. Complex aroma with some nice oaky tones. Also some fruit. Flavour is very sour but the deep flavours of oak and fruit do balance it out a little.
Flaske: Rødbrun øl med et stort skumhoved. Duften er primært balsamico, der igen dominere i smagen. Virkelig en dejlig øl men lige lidt under cuvee de ranke. Begge  dejlige og yderst drikbare.

2007 vintage tasted at home. I picked up this bottle for $11 at a local beer store that was just trying to move some stock. Score for me. Ill be returning to purchase the remaining bottles. It pours a very dark murky red/brown color with a khaki head. The aroma is very vinous with lots of tart berries, oak, brown sugar, and hints of balsamic and leather. It has great balance of sweet/sour aromas. The flavor is pretty much the same with tremendous balance and harmony. Sweet brown sugar cuts the tartness of the berry character which is boosted by only a hint of balsamic and the vanilla/oak provides subtle background notes adding to the complexity. The funk is subdued allowing the sweet and sour aspect to really shine. Overall, I loved this one. Compelling and rich.......

0.75 l bottle (vintage 2008), thanks hanniku! Hazy red brown color. Sweet and sour with acetic acid, sour cherry, leather and vanilla. Sweet and sour flavor with acetic acid, nuts and cherries. Some acetic sharpness but otherwise smooth creamy palate.  Slightly too acetic but still quite tasty dessert.

Vintage 2007. Quite surprizing one, but in line with Rodenbachs products. Whats nice, over the aroma and taste, is the fact that it is low in alcool, so you can have 2 glasses without any hesitation and still take the car :-)
This is one of the favorite beer of my fiance, and I must confess this is a great one!

2009 vintage.  After some of the other Rodenbachs I was expecting something more extreme than what I achieved, hence the high scores in all categories baring the all important overall.  If anything this is one of the more approachable Sour Ales I have tried, but will admit I am anything but a connoisseur on this style (forgive me beer gods).

2007 vintage. Draft at Capones in Norristown, PA. 

Pours a dark golden ruby color with tangerine hues and a half finger off white head that slowly fades into a lasting ring. Minimal lacing left behind. 

Sweet funky aroma with a decent amour of acetic vinegar and a strong barrel presence. Hints of earthy oak and vanilla followed by some dark fruit especially vinous grape and dark cherry. Vinegar presence without smelling like acetic nail polish. 

Medium bodied with sharp carbonation up front followed by earthy oak, tart, acetic funk and vinous frut. The barrel presence is strong with lots of toasted oak and vanilla followed by the dark fruit notes before lingering into a bone dry, puckering acetone finish. Lots of puckering vinegar in the finish leaving me salivating for more. Funky, acetic, sweet and dry. Very comlex and flavorful but a bit tough to drink.

Ive had the 2007 and 2008 Vintage bottle and 2008 Vintage on draft at the Kulminator.  Pours a reddish brown color. Aromas of easter egg, dark fruit, yeast, and a touch of wood. Flavor is sour cherries, yeast, wood, and a nice tart finish.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2014 Bottle 
2011: Frothy White good mostly deminishing head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy slightly sour aroma. Heavy bitter wonderfull sour flavor. Long great complex finish. Creamy palate. This beer should have year-addition to database.

2010: 5-2-5-3-9. Frothy white good mostly deminishing head. Amber very cloudy colour. Light malty and hoppy aroma. Very unpleasent sour aroma and flavor. No balance at all. Alas longfinish. Oily palate. Can a sour be off?

(bottle - corked & caged 750 ml - 2008 vintage) Deep ruby red pour with a thin white head. Monster sour and tart aroma with some light fruity notes underneath it all. Amazing sour flavor at the start with a very light fruity and oaky sweet undertone. The funky tartness lasts through all of the beer and into the finish but leaves a very lightly sweet aftertaste.
Pours ruby-brown with a thin, soft beige head.  Nose of cherries, wood, cereal, and malt.  Earthy and tart.  Taste offers the same.  Big but inviting.  Pleasant tartness and lively mouthfeel.
Pours a light hazy brown with a thin beige head. Sweet classic Rodenbach aroma, candy like. Candied cherry and malt. Light tart sourness, and a long sweet and sour finish.
Vintage 2009. Red/brown pour with light white head. Vinous aroma and a sweet/sour flavor of caramel, grapes and cherries. Smooth but with some bite in the finish. Nice.
Bottle shared at the TOPSH.  Murky reddish brown pour with an off white head.  Cherry aromas.  This is the definition a FlandersRed ale...........

Bottle shared at Dstructo Tower of Sour Power. I think it was 50belair that provided this one. The nose on this really stung my nostrils, it sort of surprised me how potent it was. A good bit of sour fruit and funk. The flavor was sweet and sour, sort of Duchess esc, at least thats the first thing that came to my head. Pretty powerful stuff, perhaps a little too powerful.

(750ml bottle vintage 2007) cloudy ruby-copper with soapy medium tan bubbles. Nose is lightly acetic, cherry wood, light sugar, tart, nice and funky. Taste of oak, cherry, a bit of sugar, nice bite, fruity, great creamy linger thats near perfect. Perfect amount of oxidation here. Best Flanders Red I have ever had.

75 cl bottle at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Shared with Joes and Dutchdrebus. Cloudy, hazy dark orange to light red color. Very small white to off-white head. Smell sour and lightly yeasty. Taste moderately acidic. Sour, dry finish. Low to medium body, soft carbo.
Brown to amber colour with a small lacing head. Fresh, sour, oak, wine. Tastes sour, fresh, wine, oak. Quite nice. Good mouthfeel. Nice sour ale.
Red brown liquid. Fruit, oak and sour. Not very complex but tasty nonetheless. I would like another bottle, please.

Bottle from Systembolaget, 2008 Vintage.

Hazy brown colour with off-white head. Vinegar with raisins, tart plums and cherries in the aroma. Pleasant sour taste is soft with the tart fruits ruling the game. Very well balanced package.

2007 Bottle. Courtesy of Jason Bertrand, who cant remember his Ratebeer name, but is a great friend nonetheless. Aroma of chocolate, waffle cone, cherry and caramel apple. Appearance was reddish brown with tan head. Flavor matches the nose; I have never had a more chocolate filled sour. Sour cherries and tart grape round out the finish. Palate was very bubbly. A real pleasure.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2011 75cl bottle. 2007 vintage. Deep amber colour with small beige head. Aroma is caramel malts, tart cherries, some tart fruits as well as mild alcohol. Flavour is fruits, some quite dry wooden notes, tartness as well as some mild alcoholic notes Soft, smooth and complex as no other sour.

Tap, Kulminator.  Pours a clear ruby red body with a beautiful creamy off-white head that had amazing retention.  The nose is acidic and tart with some sour cherry and nice woody notes.  The flavor is a bit acetic, but much less than the Vin de Cereal.  Much more drinkable.  Full of sour tart cherry front to back with just the right amount of underlying sweetness.  Some nice tannic wood on the finish.  Mouthfeel is bone dry and refreshing with perfect soft fizzy carbonation.  Delicious, much better than the Vin de Cereal.

Jag har redan gett Grand cru ett högt betyg men tycker att denna är mer välbalanserad eftersom syran och sötman inte sticker ut så mycket, mer komplex smakbild där ekens strävhet blir tydlig. Körsbär och vinös cider. Solklart den bäst flamländska öl jag druckit.

Bottle. Poured a beautiful deep dark red with a light white head. Aroma was full and complex: Cherries, some raspberry and blackberry, with notes of caramel and vanilla, as well as a grassiness that hid behind it all. Nice balance of sweet and sour, with a winey complexity. Every sip had something new to discover. Suprisingly more refreshing and less winey than the Grand Cru. Lingering creamy palate with grapey after taste.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2011 08 bottle. Pours a nice dark reddish color with brownish notes and a beige head. Aroma is really sour and tart, balsamic vinegar, loads of dark fruits, cherries, sugary notes, oak and some caramel. Flavor is also quite sour and is intensly complex, lots of grapey vinous notes, balsamic vinegar, dark fruits, cherries, sugary notes, caramel and some red apple like notes. The body is medium with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a fantastic brew, im am so glad I got a bottle of this! One of my all time favorite Flemish Sours for sure!

Bottle (2008, barrel 96): Redish brown with a thin tan ring of head around the glass, aroma is tart with hints of the oak barrel, taste is sour, tart and acidic. I dont have a regular Grand Cru to compare right now but I dont feel this is significantly different than the regular one.  Still very good.

750 ml bottle. 2008 version, barrel no. 96.
Pours a hazy reddish brown colour with a small slightly off-white head. Strong sour and fruity aroma of cherries and strawberries. Strong flavour of sour fruits such as cherries, strawberries, vanilla and also vinegar with warming oak notes. Full bodied, smooth bodied, decent carbonation and a long, warming, sour and quite strong finish of fruits. Top-notch sour ale and this clearly has aging potential.

Vintage 2007. Brownish coloured beer with some light carbonation and a very small off-white ehad. Very special aroma. Sweet sour fruity with some herby hints. Clear Rodenbach yeasty hints. Full sprankling palate. Finish is fresh fruity, light soury and herby. Lovely combination of flavours. Nicely balanced.

Bottle 75cl from Lio thanks a lot, a clear red beer with medium head. Nose is like a oude bruin with cherries and maderisation notes. Aroma is fruity, sour and sweet, very pleasant (more sweet than usual grand cru). This beer is vinous, not too acid, very carbonated, pleasant easy drinkable the oak and cherries notes are very fine, a great stuff.

2007 bottle. Murky brown with a beige head. Aroma of cherries, strawberries, tart apples, wood - OK but doesnt promise all that much. Slippery mouthfeel. Taste is sweet and sour with very tightly integrated flavours. Theres berries, brown sugar, vinegar, oak, vanilla, almonds, white pepper. Some acid and wood at the end. Intense and fairly complex but really easy drinking.

Bottle (2008).Light amber, hazy, short and fully diminishing head.  Moderate, vinous and lightly sweetish aroma, some sourness and fruitiness with some dark fruits, faint vanilla  oak.  Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, cherry fruitiness, some sourness with faint vanilla. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, cherry sourish fruitiness and faint vanilla. Aroma has vinous sourness, as aroma has more sweetish cherry fruitiness  aroma and flavor not in balance.

2008 Vintage. Brown with a amber touch and a small white head. Acidity, wood, vanillia and caramel in the nose. More of the same in the mouth but with some additional and hints of sherry (especially above recommended serving temperature, which is the way I like it). Altogether a complex and interesting beer.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2011 
++++ RE-RATE 20 July 2011 ++++

The following are notes from a blind tasting of sour brown and sour red beers at beastiefan2ks house.  The beers were served in sets of three, three flights total.  All beers were served blindly, with a random order.  This was really well set up, and a bunch of fun - thanks Eugene!

Beer #1 - Squatters 529.
Aroma - Aroma of light sour vinegar clears quickly revealing some nice lemon citrus tartness.  Clean.  7
Appearance - hazed copper ruby pour, with a smallish off white head.  4
Taste - Taste is the bright vinegar sour of the nose, lemon, some nice oak barrel.  Flavors nicely melded.  8
Palate - spritzy carbonation, medium light bodied, bright clean finish.  4
Overall - Nice beer, bright clean natural flavors.  14
Final Score - 3.7

Beer #2 - Nøgne Ø Tyttebær.
Aroma - a lot of rubber right away, some floral, all a big mish mash - weird stuff.  6
Appearance - Hazed, golden orange with a light white head.  4
Taste - The rubber, lightly sour malt, herbal, spice, weird as expected.  Rubber comes back around in the finish.  5
Palate - Medium bodied, grainy mouth feel, lower carbonation level.  3
Overall - Strange stuff.  11
Final Score - 2.9

Beer #3 - New Belgium La Folie09 cork and cage.
Aroma - Light sour, ginger citrus, grassy - nicely put together, but less aggressive than #1.  6
Appearance - Light haze, brown bronze, not much of an off white head.  4
Taste - Blackberry, fruit sour cherry, light spiced yeastiness.  Really soft and nicely integrated sour character.  9
Palate - Medium bodied, nice tingly carbonation, tart fruit finish.  Quite drinkable.  4
Overall - Enjoyable beer, great balance between sour character and clean drinkability.  15
Final Score - 3.8

Beer #4 - Eugenes Home Brew.
Aroma - Potpourri spice, light vanilla, some additional floral yeast aromas.  6
Appearance - Lightly hazed brown, caramel colored, pretty much no head.  3
Taste - Woody potpourri spice, bit of a cherry character, along with some weird apple peel sour.  Lemon and cilantro in the lingering finish.  7
Palate - Medium to light bodied, spritzy carbonation, woody finish.  4
Overall - Interesting flavors, though a touch heavy handed on the potpourri.  13

Beer #5 - Zoetzuur Flemish Reserve Ale.
Aroma - Spiced nutmeg, lightly herbal yeasty.  6
Appearance - Hazed brown light ruby, touch of a white head.  4
Taste - Light cocoa flavor, caramel, paired with lightly tar acidity.  6
Palate - Medium to heavy bodied, mouth coating, lingering spiced nut finish.  3
Overall - Independently I liked the sweetness and acidity, though I did not feel they worked very well together.  13
Final Score - 3.2

Beer #6 - Rodenbach Vintage07.
Aroma - Vanilla, cherries, bit of funk.  Nice clean aroma.  7
Appearance - Hazed brown copper with a smallish egg white head.  4
Taste - Gentle bright cherries, lightly tart, nice acetic character.  Flavors pleasantly subdued, and well integrated.  8
Palate - Medium bodied, bright cherry fruit in the finish.  4
Overall - Nice beer, really liked the integration of the fruit and vinegar sour.  14
Final Score - 3.7

Beer #7 - Cigar City Vuja De.
Aroma - Light vinegar, tart sour, nice cherry fruit.  Fresh and clean nose.  7
Appearance - Hazed brown ruby along with a smallish tan head.  4
Taste - Bright lemongrass, lightly floral, tart cherry, grassy - quite a bit of variety in flavors, nicely melded.  8
Palate - Medium bodied, bright clean finish.  4
Overall - Enjoyed this, had the brightest fruit expression of the night.  14
Final Score - 3.7

Beer #8 - Two Brothers Moaten.
Aroma - Initially vegetal, pear fruit comes out as it opens, light funk in the back.  6
Appearance - Flat pour, light hazed golden copper with a smallish off white head.  4
Taste - Lightly sour, citrus, floral, earthy, tart, a bit woody in the lasting finish.  7
Palate - Medium bodied, lower carbonation, residual herbal woodiness in the finish.  4
Overall - Decent, not as well integrated as others in the tasting.  13
Final Score - 3.4

Beer #9 - Baladin Super Baladin Sour Edition.
Aroma - Light floral, sour citrus funk, some general toilet odors.  6
Appearance - Hazed, unfiltered looking orange amber with a ring of a white head.  4
Taste - Sweet caramel, tart citrus, lots of burnt caramel.  Interesting lingering finish with clove and yeast.  7
Palate - Medium to heavy bodied, lighter carbonation level, lingering sweet caramel and tart finish.  4
Overall - Sort of odd interplay between caramel sweetness, tartness and an almost roast character.  Weird, but interesting.  14
Final Score - 3.5

Rating #2,000.  750 ml corked and caged bottle purchased at Zipps, in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Barrel No 230, 2007 Vintage. Pour is a murky golden brown, with a. smallish off white head. Aroma is really soft tart cherry, acidic vinegar, and a very natural woodiness. All aromas are really nicely integrated, all come across as very natural, and very soft.  I really enjoy how "put together" Rodenbach beers seem.  The taste is the tart cherry and vinegar acidity. The woodiness is more oaky than the nose suggested, but still is nicely integrated with the other flavors. Palate is medium bodied, lower carbonation level, and clean a vinegar finish. Enjoyable one.   (8,4,7,4,15 - 3.8)

2008 Vintage.  Really really enjoyed this one.  Raisin/crimson/pinot noir colored pour with a small eggshell head.  Tons of balsamic, brown sugar, Jolly Rancher, spice, wood, dark cherry skins, vanilla...lots of surprising complexity.  Yum!

Bottled. A murky brown beer with a tan head. The aroma has notes of brettanomyces, vinegar, and fruits. The flavor is sweet and a bit acidic with notes of fruits, brettanomyces, wood, and vinegar, leading to a lightly tart finish.
Tap from 2008. Hazy dark amber/brown with medium off-white head. Flavour is malt, sour, sweet, fruit, wood, little cherries and a little tart.
Hazy dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma is quite sweet, cherries and wood. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 200711
(Bottle 20/07-2011) Low head, amber color, sour sparkling and a bit sweet taste. Vintage 2008. Not my taste.

Tasted from a 750mL corked and caged bottle purchased at Binnys in Skokie, 2008 vintage, barrel number 96.  Pours cloudy dark amber with an average tan head that slowly recedes to thin, spotty lace.  The nose is sweet and sour balsamic with caramel and bread malt, and some underlying vanilla oak with just a hint of spicy peppercorn.  The flavor is more sour than sweet with balsamic vinegar, caramel and bread malt, and oaky vanilla and cinnamon.  The body is medium with average, very smooth carbonation, and a long balsamic vinegar and tannic vanilla oak finish.

Corked bottleDark amber to mahogany color, hazy, with red shades; medium sized creamy head. Sour aroma, some acetone, light malt. Good body, with moderate sweetness, light malt flavor; it has a good fruity and acidic touch, still with some acetone, and traces of wood. The fruity and sweet side reminds me of the old Duchesse de Bourgogne, but without reaching the same levels of elegance.

750 ml bottle thanks to Jacob. Barrel number 230 2007 vintage. Pours out a deep red hue with a medium white head. The aroma is that massive distinct Flemish sour, some burning sourness but more sweet cherries and vanilla. A sweet oak, vanilla and cherry flavor again with just some and certainly not dominating, sourness. Rodenbach has a very distinct flavor with a brown ale sort of malt, loads of sour cherries, some light very sour elements that are there, vinegar, very nice. The oak didnt seem overly noticeable which isnt surprisingly because this beer would already taste oaky due to the tannin like sour/earthiness in the brew. Excellent. Easy to drink a lot of. There type of beers really seem like Summer seasonals to me.

Bottled from Systembolaget. Vintage 2008
Sour, vinous, oaky and fruity aroma.
Sour and pretty sweet flavour. Oak, vinegar and sour fruits.
Vry refreshing.

Bottle, 75cl corked. 2007 vintage. A clear, dark amber to brown beer. A beige head forms. Lots of fruityness and vinegar on the nose, with berries and some cellar. Caramel towards the end in the flavor, else its filled with fruityness, berries and vinegar. Quite acidic finish. Full-bodied and smooth. A nice one, drinking dangerously easy considering the ABV, and damn tasteful too. 110311

Original 2007 vintage ("Barrel #230").  750 ml bottle purchased a year and a half ago at Holiday Wine Cellar ($17.99).  Pours a murky-muddy brown with some red mixed in and with a full finger of beige foam.  Aroma is smoother and less tart/acidic than the regular Grand Cru with notes of cherry, bready malts, dry wood, and light vinegar.  Flavor also leans away from the tart-acidic on the sour scale, having lots of nice semi-sweet fruity jam (cherry, raspberry) along with nice dry oaky notes and hints of vinegar.  A well nuanced and remarkably smooth "sour" ale.  (258, 575)

Amazing beer, classic Rodenbach but much more refined than Grand Cru. Oak character is integrated perfectly, sourness comes across as much sharper but less acetic and there is greater depth of malt flavours (raisins, fresh earth and fruit/nut chocolate). Well worth the price tag.

75 cl bottle 2007. Redbrown with a fizzy beige head that dissapears quickly but sticks to the glass. The smell is typical Rodenbach but with a nice touch of wood. Yeah you definitly smell the wood with hints of madera (probalby because of the wood). Taste is sour with hints of apple. Great beer, refreshing beer. Short aftertaste that makes you want to take the next zip.

25.4 oz bottle, 2007.  Woody brown, clear at the edge, with spotty beige froth.  Nose is white vinegar, apple cider, toffee and oak.  Juicy medium body with soft carb.  Taste is raspberry jam and Cranapple.  Bold and vibrant with restrained leathery sourness.
2008. Pours a dusty brown. A little white head. Aroma is dry grass, and sour. Tons of sour. The flavor is so balanced with sour, and sweet, with a great dry finish. Amazing beer.

2007 Vintage drank in 2010.  This is Rodenbach.  Aged.  So yah, its incredibly dank and everything that Rodenback already is, just nicely blended together, and with a nice touch of heavier oak flavors added in there.  Heady biz buds.  $16 a bottle though?  CMon now.

Bottle, shared by Enjoyit. Color is deep red, small white head. Aroma has a lovely, fruity sourness, very vinous with some candy, yeast, dough and sour fruits. Taste is heavily sour with fresh sour berries, extremely fruity and thick with sweetness as well. Nice balance.

Serving: 750 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors. 2008 vintage. It pours a hazy reddish brown with a healthy white head.  The nose is a mix of nail polish, cherries, and old barn.  The flavor starts off with a tart note then a bit of sweetness.  Notes of dried cherries, leather, barnyard, vanilla, and oak.  Really quite nice.  Medium bodied with average carbonation leading to a medium to long, dry finish.  Quite a nice brew and definitely worth trying.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2012 2007 Vintage (Barrel No. 230),  served in a Palm tulip. Reviewed on 05-24-2011. Presentation is fantastic, foil covered caged and corked bottle with a classy label. I was surprised to see that the cork was was so small, it only goes about a half inch into the bottle making it pop off quite easily. Pours a great hazy brown/red color with a decent head that fades quickly. The smell is of cherries, stone fruit, malt, oak and light funk/vinegar. The taste follows the scent, but with a tart sour finish that sticks around for a while. The oak and cherry/fruits blend together really well. This is a very good beer, easily the best Rodenbach I have tried.

look: 4  smell: 4.5  taste: 4.5  feel: 4.5  overall: 4.5. --------
 Vintage (Barrel No. 96), 750ml into a palm tulip. Reviewed on  01-22-2012.

A - Dark mahogany body with a murky brown and red tint. Very hazy and lets little light pass through. Creamy light khaki colored head with large bubbles. Solid lacing.

S - Strong cherry aroma, followed by some rich malts and oak. Really strong on the vanilla and wood. The finish is lactic and vinegary.

T - Follows the nose closely. Starts off with some bready malts and stone fruit. Then comes the lactic vinegar bite. The finish is really smooth with cherry, oak, vanilla, and a hint of spice. Carbonation is really high, more so than I would have liked. The mouth feel is medium and velvety smooth though.

O - I enjoyed the 2007 vintage just a bit more than this one. Im pretty sure this is pasteurized so aging really doesnt help out a whole lot, but I remember the 07 having a bit less carbonation which helps with the smooth flavors. Still a fantastic flanders.

look: 4  smell: 4.5  taste: 4.5  feel: 4  overall: 4.5

2008.  Pours hazy light brown into a snifter. Tan head with little retention recedes to pencil in rim. Sour cherry pits and vinegar aromas. Sharp, sour grapes and marshmallow front to back.  Lasting tart finish.

2008 vintage on draught at Bier Temple, Amsterdam 2011. Beautiful red colour. The aroma is slighty sweet with oak and sour notes. The oak is well balanced with the sour characters which linger nicely. A very nice beer indeed!

2007 bottle/barrel 230. During sour atoms with a good amount of old spicy  wood. Cloudy brown color with a medium tan head.  Spicy bitter beginning. Quickly turning sour and only fading slightly in the finish. The sour flavor is amazing.

Slightly hazy deep red amber colour with a thin (in texture, not volume) white head, which is mostly lasting though.
Aroma slightly tart, wood, oak vanilla, malts and marzipan. Sour cherries. 
Flavour is lightly sour, but surprisingly well balanced with sweet tones. Reminding of good balsamic vinegar. Good malty tones, lactic acid accents and the oak comes out nicely. Very enjoyable, more drinkable than the foederbier and grand cru, even though I think I like those better. Maybe missing some of the "in-your-face" character of the other Rodenbachs, but making up for it by being so composed and drinkable.
(from tap -wisselfust- @ Café Jos, Nijmegen)
Vintage 2008.  Beautiful aroma of oak, sour cherry.  The appearance is a semi clear red/brown, off-white head.  the flavor is sour cherries, oak.  The finish is tart fruit.  Awesome.

A taste of HEAVENPours an orange-brown colored body with a spare frothy ivory head.  Aroma is made up of dark berries, citrus, lime, and alcohol.  The mouthfeel is medium in body and high in warmth with a biting finish. Flavor of grass, spice, cherry, subtle oak, and sour red apples.  Just perfect!!!

Bottle from 2007. Aroma is very winey with oak and vanilla, brett notes, slightly lacto, vinegar, slight oxidation, berries, sweetness. Taste is very nicely balanced vinegary tartness, balsamico sweetness, oak, vanilla, insane balance like all Rodenbach.
Bottle. Brown - amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is cherry, oak, sourness, oak. Flavour is sourness, cherry, oak, berries, malt, vinegar. Full body. Very nice beer.

Dezent säuerlicher Antrunk mit holzigen Malznoten, die sehr ausgereift erscheinen, fast schon behäbig. Dennoch schmeckt das Bier frisch, es ist viel Kohlensäure vorhanden, das Bier ist leicht hopfig. Einfach abgerundet, die Säuerlichkeit spielt die zentrale Rolle, ist aber nie aufdringlich und von Zeit zu Zeit sogar nur hintergründig vorhanden. Super Bier! 9/12/13/12/12/13

Shared bomber thx to ekstedt (vintage 2008), ons 2011-04-01 Göteborg AR: wee cherries, cherrie seads, kriek???, tart/sour, vanilla
AP: bourbon res, 2 cm wee bubbly beige head
F: tart/sour, light vanilla tones,  wee kriek, 3,8 *
Bottle Vintage 2008. Reddish brown colour. Sweet and sour, but very balanced. Lactic, oaky and fruity notes. Not too much carbonation. Higly drinkable.

Bottle at mesandsims tasting. Murky ruby brown with a small hint of red, brown, pink head. Sours arent my thing but this is more me. The vinegar notes of the original are mellower and it seemed more complex to me. Sweetness off setting against the sourness. The oak againg really compliments it. And it reminded me of a perfectly carbonated ribena ale. If there was ever such a thing, this would be close. Damn tasty.

2008 vintage, on draught.  Very similar to the venerable Grand Cru. Subtle fruit and oxidative notes are the biggest differences, along with particular subtle nuances which distinguish each vintage. Not better or worse than Grand Cru, just different. Quite interesting and satisfying.

2008 Vintage on tap into a Rodenbach Grand Cru glass at Kulminator...A dark ruby brown pour, some clearness, more red then the regular. A light tan head of two fingers, great retention but only ok lacing...The aroma is slightly tart with vinegar, wish it was a bit stronger. Not as sweet or rubust as the regular, more oak...The taste is more acidic but not in a vinegary way. A lot more of the wood comes out, this is tart. This is a little bland, Im no so impressed. This is not an improvement, a lot of the vinegar is gone and replaced with oak. Dont mess with the best one going unless its going to be awesome.

On tap at Beer Temple. Vintage 2009 I believe. Slightly hazy reddish brown colour, off white head. Aroma is sour, grapes, red fruits, cherry and some raspberries, light malty. Flavour is medium sweet, red fruits, grapes, red wine, fruity sourness, tart finish. Light to medium bodied. Refreshing and highly drinkable.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2012 (tumbler glass 2008 vintage)  Pours a creamy off white one finger head.  Aroma is of sour cherries, lemon and vinigar.  The tasting is very complex, heavy sweetness, perfect sourness and a low adicity.  Also has notes of cherries, vinegar and a little lemon.  The mouthfeel has an amazing creaminess, light carbonation and medium body.  This is a very complex brew for the sour ale drinker.

Deep red color, small white head. Aroma of sour cherries, vinegar, plums, oak. Quite vinous. Flavour is sweet and sour at the same time with plums, cherries, vinegar, and some light oak. Soft carbonation, small bubbles. Mediumbodied.

2007 Vintage Oak Aged Ale (Barrel No. 230).  On tap at Capones on November 7, 2010 on our way back from Night of the Funk.

Pours a nice ruby red color with a short light-tan head that doesnt leave much lacing behind. The nose is overly acetic, though behind that there is some oak and light cherries. A touch of sweetness in the taste, but still really acetic and vinegary. Light oak and a bit of tannins.

The mouthfeel was actually the highlight of this beer for me. While I didnt like the acidity throughout the nose and taste, feeling that it overpowered anything else that was there, this was nice on its own. Overall, however, just not enough going on here to justify all that high of a score.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 11-14-2010

750 ml bottle. Red-brown body. Beige head.  Fruity nose, raisin, figs, some toffee and brown sugar. Flavor is little sour and in the same way sweet. It´s fruity, cherry-like has figs and some brown sugar. Palate is medium big and the liquid is little "sticky". Nice quite complex brew.

Courtesy of rayl101. Mahogany, white head, spotty lacing. Aroma is lots of sweet cherry, light vinegar, light sweaty feet. Flavor is rather sweet, lots of sweet cherry, light acetone, light vinegar. Decent overall.

Vintage 2008, bottle courtesy of tgncc. Pours a deep ruby/brown with a thin head that dissipates to a thin ring. Body is light, and crisp. Aroma is acidic, with notes of oak, and a little cherry. Flavor is much the same with a slight cherry flavor. Nice dry finish. Enjoyed this a bunch.
Pours dark red with a small head. The aroma is vinous, sharp and tart, but not too assertive. The flavour is tart again with wine qualities, oak is present, some sweet caramel. Nice big palate.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2013 Bottle from Mane Liquor. 2007 and 2009 Vintage. Had at Mane Liquors private tasting. This was fantastic, most memorable of the night. After an impressive Geuze Mariage Parfait, this one blew us all away. Pours a dark, murky orange with a big beige head. Has a very woody/oaky nose with hints of berries and vanilla with light tart. Taste is fantastic. Sourness is in superb balance. Oak comes into play with berries (raspberries, cranberries), some spiciness and sourness comes through. Touch peppery with heavy vanilla. The oak card is played perfectly. Not sour like most sours but done in perfect unison. Fantastic

Bottle. Amber beer with a big beige head. Malty sourish aroma, vinous, fruity, raisins, plums, okay, dry and some vinegar notes. Sourish flavor, apples, plums, vinous, a little yeasty, figs, raisins and vinegar notes.

Tap at Sugar Maple.  2008 vintage.  I was skeptical of trying this because Ive had so many Rodenbachs that have an "off-flavor" that I dont care so much for.  Anyway, the beer seems to have none of that.  Perhaps the aging and/or oak took care of that?  I consumed this beer rather quickly, so I must have really liked it.  Pours to a rusty brown body with a light beige head.  The aroma is sour cherry vinegar and oak laden rhubarb.  Theres a lot of nice things going on in the beer.  The flavor was tart, but not super puckering.  More balanced than I was expecting.  But, that was part of the enjoyment.  Oaky sour cherries and rhubarb was met with a bunch of malt.  The palate was pretty light and super easy to drink.  Crisp and clean.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2014 Bottle (75 cl) from systembolaget. Clear mahogny, fluffy off-white head. Red berries aroma, with some wood, and soft vinegar notes. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Nicely balanced sweetness and acidity.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2012 Courtesy of ekstedt. Pours cherry amber with bubbly tanned head keaving nice lace. Aroma is old damp cellar, sour, cherry and slightly sweet. Sour fresh medium mouthfeel. Pleasant fruity, a bit phenolic, sweet and berry flavor. Medium sour palate. Finishes sweet, tart and earthy. 
121214: bottle 75 cl shared with Lotta, 2007 vintage. Pours murky mahogany with a nice ranned diminishng head leaving laces. Aroma is sweet sour honey lemon juice acetone fruity; so well in balance. Flavor even better than the aroma; sweet sour honey in front acetone lemon juice malts fruits raisins from middle to end finishing with a tart sweet and slightly bitter fruity aftertaste.
2008 Vintage (although it could have been 2007... It was a long night). Nice sour notes. I liked this one!

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy mahogany, with a beige head. Huge, sour nose, lots of malt, fruit and red berries, wood, and soy. Medium dry, medium bodied, very acidic. Very rich and complex taste, really well balanced sourness, lots of wood, red berries, malt, spicy and aromatic. Very long aftertaste, extremely well balanced. (2010-09-30)

Vintage 2007 - Barrel no. 230. 
I love sour ales, but hadnt had this one yet. It is light brown/orange with a bit of red, with a small head. Smells great, vinous, oaky, notes of strawberry and caramel. The taste is sour and fruity (cranberries?) and the oak is more present, with a slightly musty aftertaste. This is definitely one of the best sour ales Ive had, and maybe beats Goudenband, my favourite so far. Im definitely buying another one!

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2011 Bottle: 2007:
Big off white to light yellow head on top of a dirty dark orange beer with a ruby tint to it.
Smell sour, yeast, wood, lemon, red fruits and dust.
Taste earth, wood, red fruit, dust, yeast, spices, lightly toasted malts, cookies, light sour and sweet.
Aftertaste of sour and hints of sweet and something sweet cookie a like.
Low carbo, soft mouthfeel, full body and an almost oily texture.
Very well balanced. Interesting brew.

text: On tap at The Kulminator, Antwerp, Belgie, 18.03.11   Pours reddy brown in colour with a light beige head. Sour with some tart fruitiness on the nose and a little wet wood. Cherries in mouth, quite tart and clacky with some wet woodiness, good tang and really drinkable.  Marvellous stuff.  A8 A4 T8 P4 Ov15 3.9
On tap at Wildeman. Dark red body with medium head. Fruity and cherry nose. Taste is very tart and sweet. Quite sour too. Enjoyable but not my style... Pleasure to have had on tap though.
Brown-reddish beer with a small white head. Very nice sour cherry aroma. Taste starts off good and sour but it ends sweet (unfortunatly). (corked bottle 75cl, vintage 2008)

2007 Vintage. Pours cloudy brown, with a ruby tinge and a smallish head. Nose is magnificent. Take the grape, fig, and caramel of the Roche 10, and add tart cherries and just a faint bit of lemon to liven things up. Big, full flavor, right up front, that moves from sweet fruits and caramel into a burst of sour blackberry/cassis, all underlaid by a lovely hint of oak. The tartness builds with each sip, making you feel like guzzling this one down - every taste leaves you wanting more. Addicting... and utterly delicious. Fantastic!

2008 vintage, on draft at Stubbys in Milwaukee.  Pours a light brown with a white head.  Aroma is fruity, cherry, and a little bit of funk.  Light on the palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is sour, tart, cherry, and a little bit of malt.  A very good beer, and a nice extension to the regular Rodenbach line-up, although Im not sure its worth the mark up over the Grand Cru.

2008 bottle picked up at SL.. Caged and corked... Pours a dark ruby red color. Decent head. Nice tart aroma. Taste is fantastic... tart, borderline sour but so well balanced... nice cherry, light grape flavor... Not picking up any flavors from the oak though. Great. Texture is smooth and very enjoyable... Overall: A great beer.... what a way to kick off march madness tourney! For the price.. I would have to pick the rodenbach grand cru
